House File 587 - Introduced


                                 HOUSE FILE 

                                 HOUSE FILE 
                                 HOUSE FILE                                  HOUSE FILE                                  BY  COMMITTEE ON
                                     TRANSPORTATION

                                 (SUCCESSOR TO HSB 176)

 A BILL FOR

  1 An Act relating to the regulation of agreements between
  2    manufacturers or distributors, and dealers relating to the
  3    sale of recreational vehicles and including applicability
  4    provisions.
  5 BE IT ENACTED BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF THE STATE OF IOWA:
    TLSB 2019HV (6) 86
    av/nh

PAG LIN



  1  1                           DIVISION I
  1  2                   RECREATIONAL VEHICLE SALES
  1  3    Section 1.                                       TRANSPORTATION

  3    sale of recreational vehicles and including applicability
  4    provisions.

PAG LIN



  1  1                           DIVISION I
  1  2                   RECREATIONAL VEHICLE SALES
  1  3    Section 1.    5 BE IT ENACTED BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF THE STATE OF IOWA:
    TLSB 2019HV (6) 86
    av/nh

PAG LIN



  1  1                           DIVISION I
  1  2                   RECREATIONAL VEHICLE SALES
  1  3    Section 1.      TLSB 2019HV (6) 86
    av/nh

PAG LIN



  1  1                           DIVISION I
  1  2                   RECREATIONAL VEHICLE SALES
  1  3    Section 1.      av/nh

PAG LIN



  1  1                           DIVISION I
  1  2                   RECREATIONAL VEHICLE SALES
  1  3    Section 1.  

  1  1                           DIVISION I
  1  2                   RECREATIONAL VEHICLE SALES
  1  3    Section 1.  
  1  1                           DIVISION I
  1  2                   RECREATIONAL VEHICLE SALES
  1  3    Section 1.    1  1                           DIVISION I
  1  2                   RECREATIONAL VEHICLE SALES
  1  3    Section 1.    1  2                   RECREATIONAL VEHICLE SALES
  1  3    Section 1.    1  3    Section 1.    1  4    When used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise
  1  5 requires:
  1  6    1.  "Area of sales responsibility" means the geographical
  1  7 area, agreed to by a dealer and a manufacturer or distributor
  1  8 in a manufacturer and dealer agreement, within which area
  1  9 the dealer has the exclusive right to display and sell the
  1 10 manufacturer's or distributor's new recreational vehicles of a
  1 11 particular line=make to a consumer.
  1 12    2.  "Consumer" means a person who is offered or purchases a
  1 13 new recreational vehicle in a retail transaction.
  1 14    3.  "Dealer" means any person, firm, corporation, or business
  1 15 entity licensed or required to be licensed as a motor vehicle
  1 16 dealer pursuant to chapter 322 or as a travel trailer dealer
  1 17 pursuant to chapter 322C.
  1 18    4.  "Distributor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  1 19 business entity that purchases new recreational vehicles for
  1 20 resale to a dealer.
  1 21    5.  "Factory campaign" means an effort on the part of a
  1 22 warrantor to contact a recreational vehicle owner or dealer in
  1 23 order to address a part or equipment issue.
  1 24    6.  "Family member" means a person who is the spouse, child,
  1 25 grandchild, parent, sibling, niece, or nephew of a recreational
  1 26 vehicle owner or the spouse of such a person.
  1 27    7.  "Fifth=wheel trailer" means the same as fifth=wheel
  1 28 travel trailer defined in section 321.1.
  1 29    8.  "Folding camping trailer" means a vehicle mounted on
  1 30 wheels and constructed with collapsible partial side walls
  1 31 that fold for towing by another vehicle and unfold to provide
  1 32 temporary living quarters for recreational, camping, or travel
  1 33 use.
  1 34    9.  "Line=make" means a specific series of recreational
  1 35 vehicles that include all of the following:
  2  1    a.  Are identified by a common series trade name or
  2  2 trademark.
  2  3    b.  Are targeted to a particular market segment, as
  2  4 determined by the recreational vehicle's decor, features,
  2  5 equipment, size, weight, and price range.
  2  6    c.  Have lengths and interior floor plans that distinguish
  2  7 the recreational vehicle from other recreational vehicles
  2  8 with substantially the same decor, features, equipment, size,
  2  9 weight, and price range.
  2 10    d.  Belong to a single, distinct classification of
  2 11 recreational vehicle product type having a substantial degree
  2 12 of commonality in the construction of the chassis, frame, and
  2 13 body, and in price range.
  2 14    e.  Are authorized for sale by a dealer pursuant to a
  2 15 manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  2 16    10.  "Manufacturer" means any person, firm, corporation,
  2 17 or business entity that engages in the manufacturing of
  2 18 recreational vehicles.
  2 19    11.  "Manufacturer and dealer agreement" means a written
  2 20 agreement or contract entered into between a manufacturer
  2 21 or distributor and a dealer that fixes the rights and
  2 22 responsibilities of the parties and pursuant to which the
  2 23 dealer sells new recreational vehicles.
  2 24    12.  "Motor home" means the same as defined in section 321.1.
  2 25    13.  "Park model recreational vehicle" means a vehicle that
  2 26 is all of the following:
  2 27    a.  Designed and marketed primarily as temporary living
  2 28 quarters for recreational, camping, travel, or seasonal use.
  2 29    b.  Built on a single chassis mounted on wheels.
  2 30    c.  Has a gross trailer area not exceeding four hundred
  2 31 square feet in the set=up mode, and if less than three hundred
  2 32 twenty square feet in the set=up mode would require a special
  2 33 movement permit for highway transit.
  2 34    d.  Certified by the manufacturer as complying with the
  2 35 American national standards institute A119.5 park model
  3  1 recreational vehicle standard.
  3  2    14.  "Proprietary part" means any part manufactured by or for
  3  3 and sold exclusively by a manufacturer.
  3  4    15.  "Recreational vehicle" means a vehicle which is either
  3  5 self=propelled or towed by a consumer=owned vehicle, primarily
  3  6 designed to provide temporary living quarters for recreational,
  3  7 camping, or travel use that complies with all applicable
  3  8 federal vehicle regulations."Recreational vehicle" includes a
  3  9 "motor home" and a "travel trailer".
  3 10    16.  "Supplier" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 11 business entity that engages in the manufacture of recreational
  3 12 vehicle parts, accessories, or components.
  3 13    17.  "Transient consumer" means a consumer who is temporarily
  3 14 traveling through a dealer's area of sales responsibility.
  3 15    18.  "Travel trailer" means the same as defined in section
  3 16 321.1.  "Travel trailer" includes a fifth=wheel trailer, folding
  3 17 camping trailer, and a park model recreational vehicle, but
  3 18 does not include a vehicle that is so designed as to permit it
  3 19 to be towed exclusively by a motorcycle.
  3 20    19.  "Warrantor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 21 business entity, including any manufacturer or supplier, that
  3 22 provides a written warranty to a consumer in connection with
  3 23 a new recreational vehicle or a part, accessory, or component
  3 24 of a new recreational vehicle.  "Warrantor" does not include
  3 25 a dealer, supplier, or other person, firm, corporation, or
  3 26 business entity not controlled by a manufacturer that provides
  3 27 a service contract, mechanical or other insurance, or extended
  3 28 warranties sold for separate consideration to a consumer.
  3 29    Sec. 2.    1  5 requires:
  1  6    1.  "Area of sales responsibility" means the geographical
  1  7 area, agreed to by a dealer and a manufacturer or distributor
  1  8 in a manufacturer and dealer agreement, within which area
  1  9 the dealer has the exclusive right to display and sell the
  1 10 manufacturer's or distributor's new recreational vehicles of a
  1 11 particular line=make to a consumer.
  1 12    2.  "Consumer" means a person who is offered or purchases a
  1 13 new recreational vehicle in a retail transaction.
  1 14    3.  "Dealer" means any person, firm, corporation, or business
  1 15 entity licensed or required to be licensed as a motor vehicle
  1 16 dealer pursuant to chapter 322 or as a travel trailer dealer
  1 17 pursuant to chapter 322C.
  1 18    4.  "Distributor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  1 19 business entity that purchases new recreational vehicles for
  1 20 resale to a dealer.
  1 21    5.  "Factory campaign" means an effort on the part of a
  1 22 warrantor to contact a recreational vehicle owner or dealer in
  1 23 order to address a part or equipment issue.
  1 24    6.  "Family member" means a person who is the spouse, child,
  1 25 grandchild, parent, sibling, niece, or nephew of a recreational
  1 26 vehicle owner or the spouse of such a person.
  1 27    7.  "Fifth=wheel trailer" means the same as fifth=wheel
  1 28 travel trailer defined in section 321.1.
  1 29    8.  "Folding camping trailer" means a vehicle mounted on
  1 30 wheels and constructed with collapsible partial side walls
  1 31 that fold for towing by another vehicle and unfold to provide
  1 32 temporary living quarters for recreational, camping, or travel
  1 33 use.
  1 34    9.  "Line=make" means a specific series of recreational
  1 35 vehicles that include all of the following:
  2  1    a.  Are identified by a common series trade name or
  2  2 trademark.
  2  3    b.  Are targeted to a particular market segment, as
  2  4 determined by the recreational vehicle's decor, features,
  2  5 equipment, size, weight, and price range.
  2  6    c.  Have lengths and interior floor plans that distinguish
  2  7 the recreational vehicle from other recreational vehicles
  2  8 with substantially the same decor, features, equipment, size,
  2  9 weight, and price range.
  2 10    d.  Belong to a single, distinct classification of
  2 11 recreational vehicle product type having a substantial degree
  2 12 of commonality in the construction of the chassis, frame, and
  2 13 body, and in price range.
  2 14    e.  Are authorized for sale by a dealer pursuant to a
  2 15 manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  2 16    10.  "Manufacturer" means any person, firm, corporation,
  2 17 or business entity that engages in the manufacturing of
  2 18 recreational vehicles.
  2 19    11.  "Manufacturer and dealer agreement" means a written
  2 20 agreement or contract entered into between a manufacturer
  2 21 or distributor and a dealer that fixes the rights and
  2 22 responsibilities of the parties and pursuant to which the
  2 23 dealer sells new recreational vehicles.
  2 24    12.  "Motor home" means the same as defined in section 321.1.
  2 25    13.  "Park model recreational vehicle" means a vehicle that
  2 26 is all of the following:
  2 27    a.  Designed and marketed primarily as temporary living
  2 28 quarters for recreational, camping, travel, or seasonal use.
  2 29    b.  Built on a single chassis mounted on wheels.
  2 30    c.  Has a gross trailer area not exceeding four hundred
  2 31 square feet in the set=up mode, and if less than three hundred
  2 32 twenty square feet in the set=up mode would require a special
  2 33 movement permit for highway transit.
  2 34    d.  Certified by the manufacturer as complying with the
  2 35 American national standards institute A119.5 park model
  3  1 recreational vehicle standard.
  3  2    14.  "Proprietary part" means any part manufactured by or for
  3  3 and sold exclusively by a manufacturer.
  3  4    15.  "Recreational vehicle" means a vehicle which is either
  3  5 self=propelled or towed by a consumer=owned vehicle, primarily
  3  6 designed to provide temporary living quarters for recreational,
  3  7 camping, or travel use that complies with all applicable
  3  8 federal vehicle regulations."Recreational vehicle" includes a
  3  9 "motor home" and a "travel trailer".
  3 10    16.  "Supplier" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 11 business entity that engages in the manufacture of recreational
  3 12 vehicle parts, accessories, or components.
  3 13    17.  "Transient consumer" means a consumer who is temporarily
  3 14 traveling through a dealer's area of sales responsibility.
  3 15    18.  "Travel trailer" means the same as defined in section
  3 16 321.1.  "Travel trailer" includes a fifth=wheel trailer, folding
  3 17 camping trailer, and a park model recreational vehicle, but
  3 18 does not include a vehicle that is so designed as to permit it
  3 19 to be towed exclusively by a motorcycle.
  3 20    19.  "Warrantor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 21 business entity, including any manufacturer or supplier, that
  3 22 provides a written warranty to a consumer in connection with
  3 23 a new recreational vehicle or a part, accessory, or component
  3 24 of a new recreational vehicle.  "Warrantor" does not include
  3 25 a dealer, supplier, or other person, firm, corporation, or
  3 26 business entity not controlled by a manufacturer that provides
  3 27 a service contract, mechanical or other insurance, or extended
  3 28 warranties sold for separate consideration to a consumer.
  3 29    Sec. 2.    1  6    1.  "Area of sales responsibility" means the geographical
  1  7 area, agreed to by a dealer and a manufacturer or distributor
  1  8 in a manufacturer and dealer agreement, within which area
  1  9 the dealer has the exclusive right to display and sell the
  1 10 manufacturer's or distributor's new recreational vehicles of a
  1 11 particular line=make to a consumer.
  1 12    2.  "Consumer" means a person who is offered or purchases a
  1 13 new recreational vehicle in a retail transaction.
  1 14    3.  "Dealer" means any person, firm, corporation, or business
  1 15 entity licensed or required to be licensed as a motor vehicle
  1 16 dealer pursuant to chapter 322 or as a travel trailer dealer
  1 17 pursuant to chapter 322C.
  1 18    4.  "Distributor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  1 19 business entity that purchases new recreational vehicles for
  1 20 resale to a dealer.
  1 21    5.  "Factory campaign" means an effort on the part of a
  1 22 warrantor to contact a recreational vehicle owner or dealer in
  1 23 order to address a part or equipment issue.
  1 24    6.  "Family member" means a person who is the spouse, child,
  1 25 grandchild, parent, sibling, niece, or nephew of a recreational
  1 26 vehicle owner or the spouse of such a person.
  1 27    7.  "Fifth=wheel trailer" means the same as fifth=wheel
  1 28 travel trailer defined in section 321.1.
  1 29    8.  "Folding camping trailer" means a vehicle mounted on
  1 30 wheels and constructed with collapsible partial side walls
  1 31 that fold for towing by another vehicle and unfold to provide
  1 32 temporary living quarters for recreational, camping, or travel
  1 33 use.
  1 34    9.  "Line=make" means a specific series of recreational
  1 35 vehicles that include all of the following:
  2  1    a.  Are identified by a common series trade name or
  2  2 trademark.
  2  3    b.  Are targeted to a particular market segment, as
  2  4 determined by the recreational vehicle's decor, features,
  2  5 equipment, size, weight, and price range.
  2  6    c.  Have lengths and interior floor plans that distinguish
  2  7 the recreational vehicle from other recreational vehicles
  2  8 with substantially the same decor, features, equipment, size,
  2  9 weight, and price range.
  2 10    d.  Belong to a single, distinct classification of
  2 11 recreational vehicle product type having a substantial degree
  2 12 of commonality in the construction of the chassis, frame, and
  2 13 body, and in price range.
  2 14    e.  Are authorized for sale by a dealer pursuant to a
  2 15 manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  2 16    10.  "Manufacturer" means any person, firm, corporation,
  2 17 or business entity that engages in the manufacturing of
  2 18 recreational vehicles.
  2 19    11.  "Manufacturer and dealer agreement" means a written
  2 20 agreement or contract entered into between a manufacturer
  2 21 or distributor and a dealer that fixes the rights and
  2 22 responsibilities of the parties and pursuant to which the
  2 23 dealer sells new recreational vehicles.
  2 24    12.  "Motor home" means the same as defined in section 321.1.
  2 25    13.  "Park model recreational vehicle" means a vehicle that
  2 26 is all of the following:
  2 27    a.  Designed and marketed primarily as temporary living
  2 28 quarters for recreational, camping, travel, or seasonal use.
  2 29    b.  Built on a single chassis mounted on wheels.
  2 30    c.  Has a gross trailer area not exceeding four hundred
  2 31 square feet in the set=up mode, and if less than three hundred
  2 32 twenty square feet in the set=up mode would require a special
  2 33 movement permit for highway transit.
  2 34    d.  Certified by the manufacturer as complying with the
  2 35 American national standards institute A119.5 park model
  3  1 recreational vehicle standard.

  3  3 and sold exclusively by a manufacturer.

  3  6 designed to provide temporary living quarters for recreational,
  3  7 camping, or travel use that complies with all applicable
  3  8 federal vehicle regulations."Recreational vehicle" includes a
  3  9 "motor home" and a "travel trailer".

  3 11 business entity that engages in the manufacture of recreational
  3 12 vehicle parts, accessories, or components.
  3 13    17.  "Transient consumer" means a consumer who is temporarily
  3 14 traveling through a dealer's area of sales responsibility.
  3 15    18.  "Travel trailer" means the same as defined in section
  3 16 321.1.  "Travel trailer" includes a fifth=wheel trailer, folding
  3 17 camping trailer, and a park model recreational vehicle, but
  3 18 does not include a vehicle that is so designed as to permit it
  3 19 to be towed exclusively by a motorcycle.

  3 21 business entity, including any manufacturer or supplier, that

  3 23 a new recreational vehicle or a part, accessory, or component
  3 24 of a new recreational vehicle.  "Warrantor" does not include

  3 26 business entity not controlled by a manufacturer that provides
  3 27 a service contract, mechanical or other insurance, or extended
  3 28 warranties sold for separate consideration to a consumer.

  1  8 in a manufacturer and dealer agreement, within which area

  1 10 manufacturer's or distributor's new recreational vehicles of a

  2 23 dealer sells new recreational vehicles.

  1 16 dealer pursuant to chapter 322 or as a travel trailer dealer
  1 17 pursuant to chapter 322C.
  1 18    4.  "Distributor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  1 19 business entity that purchases new recreational vehicles for
  1 20 resale to a dealer.
  1 21    5.  "Factory campaign" means an effort on the part of a
  1 22 warrantor to contact a recreational vehicle owner or dealer in
  1 23 order to address a part or equipment issue.
  1 24    6.  "Family member" means a person who is the spouse, child,
  1 25 grandchild, parent, sibling, niece, or nephew of a recreational
  1 26 vehicle owner or the spouse of such a person.
  1 27    7.  "Fifth=wheel trailer" means the same as fifth=wheel
  1 28 travel trailer defined in section 321.1.
  1 29    8.  "Folding camping trailer" means a vehicle mounted on
  1 30 wheels and constructed with collapsible partial side walls
  1 31 that fold for towing by another vehicle and unfold to provide
  1 32 temporary living quarters for recreational, camping, or travel
  1 33 use.
  1 34    9.  "Line=make" means a specific series of recreational
  1 35 vehicles that include all of the following:
  2  1    a.  Are identified by a common series trade name or
  2  2 trademark.
  2  3    b.  Are targeted to a particular market segment, as
  2  4 determined by the recreational vehicle's decor, features,
  2  5 equipment, size, weight, and price range.
  2  6    c.  Have lengths and interior floor plans that distinguish
  2  7 the recreational vehicle from other recreational vehicles
  2  8 with substantially the same decor, features, equipment, size,
  2  9 weight, and price range.
  2 10    d.  Belong to a single, distinct classification of
  2 11 recreational vehicle product type having a substantial degree
  2 12 of commonality in the construction of the chassis, frame, and
  2 13 body, and in price range.
  2 14    e.  Are authorized for sale by a dealer pursuant to a
  2 15 manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  2 16    10.  "Manufacturer" means any person, firm, corporation,
  2 17 or business entity that engages in the manufacturing of
  2 18 recreational vehicles.
  2 19    11.  "Manufacturer and dealer agreement" means a written
  2 20 agreement or contract entered into between a manufacturer
  2 21 or distributor and a dealer that fixes the rights and
  2 22 responsibilities of the parties and pursuant to which the
  2 23 dealer sells new recreational vehicles.
  2 24    12.  "Motor home" means the same as defined in section 321.1.
  2 25    13.  "Park model recreational vehicle" means a vehicle that
  2 26 is all of the following:
  2 27    a.  Designed and marketed primarily as temporary living
  2 28 quarters for recreational, camping, travel, or seasonal use.
  2 29    b.  Built on a single chassis mounted on wheels.
  2 30    c.  Has a gross trailer area not exceeding four hundred
  2 31 square feet in the set=up mode, and if less than three hundred
  2 32 twenty square feet in the set=up mode would require a special
  2 33 movement permit for highway transit.
  2 34    d.  Certified by the manufacturer as complying with the
  2 35 American national standards institute A119.5 park model
  3  1 recreational vehicle standard.
  3  2    14.  "Proprietary part" means any part manufactured by or for
  3  3 and sold exclusively by a manufacturer.
  3  4    15.  "Recreational vehicle" means a vehicle which is either
  3  5 self=propelled or towed by a consumer=owned vehicle, primarily
  3  6 designed to provide temporary living quarters for recreational,
  3  7 camping, or travel use that complies with all applicable
  3  8 federal vehicle regulations."Recreational vehicle" includes a
  3  9 "motor home" and a "travel trailer".
  3 10    16.  "Supplier" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 11 business entity that engages in the manufacture of recreational
  3 12 vehicle parts, accessories, or components.
  3 13    17.  "Transient consumer" means a consumer who is temporarily
  3 14 traveling through a dealer's area of sales responsibility.
  3 15    18.  "Travel trailer" means the same as defined in section
  3 16 321.1.  "Travel trailer" includes a fifth=wheel trailer, folding
  3 17 camping trailer, and a park model recreational vehicle, but
  3 18 does not include a vehicle that is so designed as to permit it
  3 19 to be towed exclusively by a motorcycle.
  3 20    19.  "Warrantor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 21 business entity, including any manufacturer or supplier, that
  3 22 provides a written warranty to a consumer in connection with
  3 23 a new recreational vehicle or a part, accessory, or component
  3 24 of a new recreational vehicle.  "Warrantor" does not include
  3 25 a dealer, supplier, or other person, firm, corporation, or
  3 26 business entity not controlled by a manufacturer that provides
  3 27 a service contract, mechanical or other insurance, or extended
  3 28 warranties sold for separate consideration to a consumer.
  3 29    Sec. 2.    1  9 the dealer has the exclusive right to display and sell the
  1 10 manufacturer's or distributor's new recreational vehicles of a
  1 11 particular line=make to a consumer.
  1 12    2.  "Consumer" means a person who is offered or purchases a
  1 13 new recreational vehicle in a retail transaction.
  1 14    3.  "Dealer" means any person, firm, corporation, or business
  1 15 entity licensed or required to be licensed as a motor vehicle
  1 16 dealer pursuant to chapter 322 or as a travel trailer dealer
  1 17 pursuant to chapter 322C.

  3  1 recreational vehicle standard.
  3  2    14.  "Proprietary part" means any part manufactured by or for
  3  3 and sold exclusively by a manufacturer.
  3  4    15.  "Recreational vehicle" means a vehicle which is either
  3  5 self=propelled or towed by a consumer=owned vehicle, primarily
  3  6 designed to provide temporary living quarters for recreational,
  3  7 camping, or travel use that complies with all applicable
  3  8 federal vehicle regulations."Recreational vehicle" includes a
  3  9 "motor home" and a "travel trailer".
  3 10    16.  "Supplier" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 11 business entity that engages in the manufacture of recreational
  3 12 vehicle parts, accessories, or components.
  3 13    17.  "Transient consumer" means a consumer who is temporarily
  3 14 traveling through a dealer's area of sales responsibility.
  3 15    18.  "Travel trailer" means the same as defined in section
  3 16 321.1.  "Travel trailer" includes a fifth=wheel trailer, folding
  3 17 camping trailer, and a park model recreational vehicle, but
  3 18 does not include a vehicle that is so designed as to permit it
  3 19 to be towed exclusively by a motorcycle.
  3 20    19.  "Warrantor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 21 business entity, including any manufacturer or supplier, that
  3 22 provides a written warranty to a consumer in connection with
  3 23 a new recreational vehicle or a part, accessory, or component
  3 24 of a new recreational vehicle.  "Warrantor" does not include
  3 25 a dealer, supplier, or other person, firm, corporation, or
  3 26 business entity not controlled by a manufacturer that provides
  3 27 a service contract, mechanical or other insurance, or extended
  3 28 warranties sold for separate consideration to a consumer.
  3 29    Sec. 2.    1 14    3.  "Dealer" means any person, firm, corporation, or business
  1 15 entity licensed or required to be licensed as a motor vehicle
  1 16 dealer pursuant to chapter 322 or as a travel trailer dealer
  1 17 pursuant to chapter 322C.
  1 18    4.  "Distributor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  1 19 business entity that purchases new recreational vehicles for
  1 20 resale to a dealer.
  1 21    5.  "Factory campaign" means an effort on the part of a
  1 22 warrantor to contact a recreational vehicle owner or dealer in
  1 23 order to address a part or equipment issue.
  1 24    6.  "Family member" means a person who is the spouse, child,
  1 25 grandchild, parent, sibling, niece, or nephew of a recreational
  1 26 vehicle owner or the spouse of such a person.
  1 27    7.  "Fifth=wheel trailer" means the same as fifth=wheel
  1 28 travel trailer defined in section 321.1.
  1 29    8.  "Folding camping trailer" means a vehicle mounted on
  1 30 wheels and constructed with collapsible partial side walls
  1 31 that fold for towing by another vehicle and unfold to provide
  1 32 temporary living quarters for recreational, camping, or travel
  1 33 use.
  1 34    9.  "Line=make" means a specific series of recreational
  1 35 vehicles that include all of the following:
  2  1    a.  Are identified by a common series trade name or
  2  2 trademark.
  2  3    b.  Are targeted to a particular market segment, as
  2  4 determined by the recreational vehicle's decor, features,
  2  5 equipment, size, weight, and price range.
  2  6    c.  Have lengths and interior floor plans that distinguish
  2  7 the recreational vehicle from other recreational vehicles
  2  8 with substantially the same decor, features, equipment, size,
  2  9 weight, and price range.
  2 10    d.  Belong to a single, distinct classification of
  2 11 recreational vehicle product type having a substantial degree
  2 12 of commonality in the construction of the chassis, frame, and
  2 13 body, and in price range.
  2 14    e.  Are authorized for sale by a dealer pursuant to a
  2 15 manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  2 16    10.  "Manufacturer" means any person, firm, corporation,
  2 17 or business entity that engages in the manufacturing of
  2 18 recreational vehicles.
  2 19    11.  "Manufacturer and dealer agreement" means a written
  2 20 agreement or contract entered into between a manufacturer
  2 21 or distributor and a dealer that fixes the rights and
  2 22 responsibilities of the parties and pursuant to which the
  2 23 dealer sells new recreational vehicles.
  2 24    12.  "Motor home" means the same as defined in section 321.1.
  2 25    13.  "Park model recreational vehicle" means a vehicle that
  2 26 is all of the following:
  2 27    a.  Designed and marketed primarily as temporary living
  2 28 quarters for recreational, camping, travel, or seasonal use.
  2 29    b.  Built on a single chassis mounted on wheels.
  2 30    c.  Has a gross trailer area not exceeding four hundred
  2 31 square feet in the set=up mode, and if less than three hundred
  2 32 twenty square feet in the set=up mode would require a special
  2 33 movement permit for highway transit.
  2 34    d.  Certified by the manufacturer as complying with the
  2 35 American national standards institute A119.5 park model
  3  1 recreational vehicle standard.
  3  2    14.  "Proprietary part" means any part manufactured by or for
  3  3 and sold exclusively by a manufacturer.
  3  4    15.  "Recreational vehicle" means a vehicle which is either
  3  5 self=propelled or towed by a consumer=owned vehicle, primarily
  3  6 designed to provide temporary living quarters for recreational,
  3  7 camping, or travel use that complies with all applicable
  3  8 federal vehicle regulations."Recreational vehicle" includes a
  3  9 "motor home" and a "travel trailer".

  3 11 business entity that engages in the manufacture of recreational
  3 12 vehicle parts, accessories, or components.
  3 13    17.  "Transient consumer" means a consumer who is temporarily
  3 14 traveling through a dealer's area of sales responsibility.

  3 18 does not include a vehicle that is so designed as to permit it
  3 19 to be towed exclusively by a motorcycle.

  2 35 American national standards institute A119.5 park model
  3  1 recreational vehicle standard.
  3  2    14.  "Proprietary part" means any part manufactured by or for
  3  3 and sold exclusively by a manufacturer.
  3  4    15.  "Recreational vehicle" means a vehicle which is either
  3  5 self=propelled or towed by a consumer=owned vehicle, primarily
  3  6 designed to provide temporary living quarters for recreational,
  3  7 camping, or travel use that complies with all applicable
  3  8 federal vehicle regulations."Recreational vehicle" includes a
  3  9 "motor home" and a "travel trailer".
  3 10    16.  "Supplier" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 11 business entity that engages in the manufacture of recreational
  3 12 vehicle parts, accessories, or components.
  3 13    17.  "Transient consumer" means a consumer who is temporarily
  3 14 traveling through a dealer's area of sales responsibility.
  3 15    18.  "Travel trailer" means the same as defined in section
  3 16 321.1.  "Travel trailer" includes a fifth=wheel trailer, folding
  3 17 camping trailer, and a park model recreational vehicle, but
  3 18 does not include a vehicle that is so designed as to permit it
  3 19 to be towed exclusively by a motorcycle.
  3 20    19.  "Warrantor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 21 business entity, including any manufacturer or supplier, that
  3 22 provides a written warranty to a consumer in connection with
  3 23 a new recreational vehicle or a part, accessory, or component
  3 24 of a new recreational vehicle.  "Warrantor" does not include
  3 25 a dealer, supplier, or other person, firm, corporation, or
  3 26 business entity not controlled by a manufacturer that provides
  3 27 a service contract, mechanical or other insurance, or extended
  3 28 warranties sold for separate consideration to a consumer.
  3 29    Sec. 2.    1 20 resale to a dealer.
  1 21    5.  "Factory campaign" means an effort on the part of a
  1 22 warrantor to contact a recreational vehicle owner or dealer in
  1 23 order to address a part or equipment issue.
  1 24    6.  "Family member" means a person who is the spouse, child,
  1 25 grandchild, parent, sibling, niece, or nephew of a recreational
  1 26 vehicle owner or the spouse of such a person.
  1 27    7.  "Fifth=wheel trailer" means the same as fifth=wheel
  1 28 travel trailer defined in section 321.1.
  1 29    8.  "Folding camping trailer" means a vehicle mounted on
  1 30 wheels and constructed with collapsible partial side walls
  1 31 that fold for towing by another vehicle and unfold to provide
  1 32 temporary living quarters for recreational, camping, or travel
  1 33 use.
  1 34    9.  "Line=make" means a specific series of recreational
  1 35 vehicles that include all of the following:
  2  1    a.  Are identified by a common series trade name or
  2  2 trademark.
  2  3    b.  Are targeted to a particular market segment, as
  2  4 determined by the recreational vehicle's decor, features,
  2  5 equipment, size, weight, and price range.
  2  6    c.  Have lengths and interior floor plans that distinguish
  2  7 the recreational vehicle from other recreational vehicles
  2  8 with substantially the same decor, features, equipment, size,
  2  9 weight, and price range.
  2 10    d.  Belong to a single, distinct classification of
  2 11 recreational vehicle product type having a substantial degree
  2 12 of commonality in the construction of the chassis, frame, and
  2 13 body, and in price range.
  2 14    e.  Are authorized for sale by a dealer pursuant to a
  2 15 manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  2 16    10.  "Manufacturer" means any person, firm, corporation,
  2 17 or business entity that engages in the manufacturing of
  2 18 recreational vehicles.
  2 19    11.  "Manufacturer and dealer agreement" means a written
  2 20 agreement or contract entered into between a manufacturer
  2 21 or distributor and a dealer that fixes the rights and
  2 22 responsibilities of the parties and pursuant to which the
  2 23 dealer sells new recreational vehicles.
  2 24    12.  "Motor home" means the same as defined in section 321.1.
  2 25    13.  "Park model recreational vehicle" means a vehicle that
  2 26 is all of the following:
  2 27    a.  Designed and marketed primarily as temporary living
  2 28 quarters for recreational, camping, travel, or seasonal use.
  2 29    b.  Built on a single chassis mounted on wheels.
  2 30    c.  Has a gross trailer area not exceeding four hundred
  2 31 square feet in the set=up mode, and if less than three hundred
  2 32 twenty square feet in the set=up mode would require a special
  2 33 movement permit for highway transit.
  2 34    d.  Certified by the manufacturer as complying with the
  2 35 American national standards institute A119.5 park model
  3  1 recreational vehicle standard.
  3  2    14.  "Proprietary part" means any part manufactured by or for
  3  3 and sold exclusively by a manufacturer.

  1 28 travel trailer defined in section 321.1.

  1 30 wheels and constructed with collapsible partial side walls
  1 31 that fold for towing by another vehicle and unfold to provide
  1 32 temporary living quarters for recreational, camping, or travel
  1 33 use.
  1 34    9.  "Line=make" means a specific series of recreational
  1 35 vehicles that include all of the following:
  2  1    a.  Are identified by a common series trade name or
  2  2 trademark.
  2  3    b.  Are targeted to a particular market segment, as
  2  4 determined by the recreational vehicle's decor, features,
  2  5 equipment, size, weight, and price range.
  2  6    c.  Have lengths and interior floor plans that distinguish
  2  7 the recreational vehicle from other recreational vehicles
  2  8 with substantially the same decor, features, equipment, size,
  2  9 weight, and price range.
  2 10    d.  Belong to a single, distinct classification of
  2 11 recreational vehicle product type having a substantial degree
  2 12 of commonality in the construction of the chassis, frame, and
  2 13 body, and in price range.
  2 14    e.  Are authorized for sale by a dealer pursuant to a
  2 15 manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  2 16    10.  "Manufacturer" means any person, firm, corporation,
  2 17 or business entity that engages in the manufacturing of
  2 18 recreational vehicles.
  2 19    11.  "Manufacturer and dealer agreement" means a written
  2 20 agreement or contract entered into between a manufacturer
  2 21 or distributor and a dealer that fixes the rights and
  2 22 responsibilities of the parties and pursuant to which the
  2 23 dealer sells new recreational vehicles.
  2 24    12.  "Motor home" means the same as defined in section 321.1.
  2 25    13.  "Park model recreational vehicle" means a vehicle that
  2 26 is all of the following:
  2 27    a.  Designed and marketed primarily as temporary living
  2 28 quarters for recreational, camping, travel, or seasonal use.
  2 29    b.  Built on a single chassis mounted on wheels.
  2 30    c.  Has a gross trailer area not exceeding four hundred
  2 31 square feet in the set=up mode, and if less than three hundred
  2 32 twenty square feet in the set=up mode would require a special
  2 33 movement permit for highway transit.
  2 34    d.  Certified by the manufacturer as complying with the
  2 35 American national standards institute A119.5 park model
  3  1 recreational vehicle standard.
  3  2    14.  "Proprietary part" means any part manufactured by or for
  3  3 and sold exclusively by a manufacturer.
  3  4    15.  "Recreational vehicle" means a vehicle which is either
  3  5 self=propelled or towed by a consumer=owned vehicle, primarily
  3  6 designed to provide temporary living quarters for recreational,
  3  7 camping, or travel use that complies with all applicable
  3  8 federal vehicle regulations."Recreational vehicle" includes a
  3  9 "motor home" and a "travel trailer".
  3 10    16.  "Supplier" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 11 business entity that engages in the manufacture of recreational
  3 12 vehicle parts, accessories, or components.
  3 13    17.  "Transient consumer" means a consumer who is temporarily
  3 14 traveling through a dealer's area of sales responsibility.
  3 15    18.  "Travel trailer" means the same as defined in section
  3 16 321.1.  "Travel trailer" includes a fifth=wheel trailer, folding
  3 17 camping trailer, and a park model recreational vehicle, but
  3 18 does not include a vehicle that is so designed as to permit it
  3 19 to be towed exclusively by a motorcycle.
  3 20    19.  "Warrantor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 21 business entity, including any manufacturer or supplier, that
  3 22 provides a written warranty to a consumer in connection with
  3 23 a new recreational vehicle or a part, accessory, or component
  3 24 of a new recreational vehicle.  "Warrantor" does not include
  3 25 a dealer, supplier, or other person, firm, corporation, or
  3 26 business entity not controlled by a manufacturer that provides
  3 27 a service contract, mechanical or other insurance, or extended
  3 28 warranties sold for separate consideration to a consumer.

  2  7 the recreational vehicle from other recreational vehicles
  2  8 with substantially the same decor, features, equipment, size,
  2  9 weight, and price range.
  2 10    d.  Belong to a single, distinct classification of
  2 11 recreational vehicle product type having a substantial degree
  2 12 of commonality in the construction of the chassis, frame, and
  2 13 body, and in price range.
  2 14    e.  Are authorized for sale by a dealer pursuant to a
  2 15 manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  2 16    10.  "Manufacturer" means any person, firm, corporation,
  2 17 or business entity that engages in the manufacturing of
  2 18 recreational vehicles.
  2 19    11.  "Manufacturer and dealer agreement" means a written
  2 20 agreement or contract entered into between a manufacturer
  2 21 or distributor and a dealer that fixes the rights and
  2 22 responsibilities of the parties and pursuant to which the
  2 23 dealer sells new recreational vehicles.
  2 24    12.  "Motor home" means the same as defined in section 321.1.
  2 25    13.  "Park model recreational vehicle" means a vehicle that
  2 26 is all of the following:
  2 27    a.  Designed and marketed primarily as temporary living
  2 28 quarters for recreational, camping, travel, or seasonal use.
  2 29    b.  Built on a single chassis mounted on wheels.
  2 30    c.  Has a gross trailer area not exceeding four hundred
  2 31 square feet in the set=up mode, and if less than three hundred
  2 32 twenty square feet in the set=up mode would require a special
  2 33 movement permit for highway transit.
  2 34    d.  Certified by the manufacturer as complying with the
  2 35 American national standards institute A119.5 park model
  3  1 recreational vehicle standard.
  3  2    14.  "Proprietary part" means any part manufactured by or for
  3  3 and sold exclusively by a manufacturer.
  3  4    15.  "Recreational vehicle" means a vehicle which is either
  3  5 self=propelled or towed by a consumer=owned vehicle, primarily
  3  6 designed to provide temporary living quarters for recreational,
  3  7 camping, or travel use that complies with all applicable
  3  8 federal vehicle regulations."Recreational vehicle" includes a
  3  9 "motor home" and a "travel trailer".
  3 10    16.  "Supplier" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 11 business entity that engages in the manufacture of recreational
  3 12 vehicle parts, accessories, or components.
  3 13    17.  "Transient consumer" means a consumer who is temporarily
  3 14 traveling through a dealer's area of sales responsibility.
  3 15    18.  "Travel trailer" means the same as defined in section
  3 16 321.1.  "Travel trailer" includes a fifth=wheel trailer, folding
  3 17 camping trailer, and a park model recreational vehicle, but
  3 18 does not include a vehicle that is so designed as to permit it
  3 19 to be towed exclusively by a motorcycle.
  3 20    19.  "Warrantor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 21 business entity, including any manufacturer or supplier, that
  3 22 provides a written warranty to a consumer in connection with
  3 23 a new recreational vehicle or a part, accessory, or component
  3 24 of a new recreational vehicle.  "Warrantor" does not include
  3 25 a dealer, supplier, or other person, firm, corporation, or
  3 26 business entity not controlled by a manufacturer that provides
  3 27 a service contract, mechanical or other insurance, or extended
  3 28 warranties sold for separate consideration to a consumer.

  1 35 vehicles that include all of the following:
  2  1    a.  Are identified by a common series trade name or
  2  2 trademark.
  2  3    b.  Are targeted to a particular market segment, as
  2  4 determined by the recreational vehicle's decor, features,
  2  5 equipment, size, weight, and price range.

  2  7 the recreational vehicle from other recreational vehicles

  2  9 weight, and price range.

  2  7 the recreational vehicle from other recreational vehicles
  2  8 with substantially the same decor, features, equipment, size,
  2  9 weight, and price range.
  2 10    d.  Belong to a single, distinct classification of
  2 11 recreational vehicle product type having a substantial degree
  2 12 of commonality in the construction of the chassis, frame, and
  2 13 body, and in price range.
  2 14    e.  Are authorized for sale by a dealer pursuant to a
  2 15 manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  2 16    10.  "Manufacturer" means any person, firm, corporation,
  2 17 or business entity that engages in the manufacturing of
  2 18 recreational vehicles.
  2 19    11.  "Manufacturer and dealer agreement" means a written
  2 20 agreement or contract entered into between a manufacturer
  2 21 or distributor and a dealer that fixes the rights and
  2 22 responsibilities of the parties and pursuant to which the
  2 23 dealer sells new recreational vehicles.
  2 24    12.  "Motor home" means the same as defined in section 321.1.
  2 25    13.  "Park model recreational vehicle" means a vehicle that
  2 26 is all of the following:
  2 27    a.  Designed and marketed primarily as temporary living
  2 28 quarters for recreational, camping, travel, or seasonal use.
  2 29    b.  Built on a single chassis mounted on wheels.
  2 30    c.  Has a gross trailer area not exceeding four hundred
  2 31 square feet in the set=up mode, and if less than three hundred
  2 32 twenty square feet in the set=up mode would require a special
  2 33 movement permit for highway transit.
  2 34    d.  Certified by the manufacturer as complying with the
  2 35 American national standards institute A119.5 park model
  3  1 recreational vehicle standard.
  3  2    14.  "Proprietary part" means any part manufactured by or for
  3  3 and sold exclusively by a manufacturer.
  3  4    15.  "Recreational vehicle" means a vehicle which is either
  3  5 self=propelled or towed by a consumer=owned vehicle, primarily
  3  6 designed to provide temporary living quarters for recreational,
  3  7 camping, or travel use that complies with all applicable
  3  8 federal vehicle regulations."Recreational vehicle" includes a
  3  9 "motor home" and a "travel trailer".
  3 10    16.  "Supplier" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 11 business entity that engages in the manufacture of recreational
  3 12 vehicle parts, accessories, or components.
  3 13    17.  "Transient consumer" means a consumer who is temporarily
  3 14 traveling through a dealer's area of sales responsibility.
  3 15    18.  "Travel trailer" means the same as defined in section
  3 16 321.1.  "Travel trailer" includes a fifth=wheel trailer, folding
  3 17 camping trailer, and a park model recreational vehicle, but
  3 18 does not include a vehicle that is so designed as to permit it
  3 19 to be towed exclusively by a motorcycle.
  3 20    19.  "Warrantor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 21 business entity, including any manufacturer or supplier, that
  3 22 provides a written warranty to a consumer in connection with
  3 23 a new recreational vehicle or a part, accessory, or component
  3 24 of a new recreational vehicle.  "Warrantor" does not include
  3 25 a dealer, supplier, or other person, firm, corporation, or
  3 26 business entity not controlled by a manufacturer that provides
  3 27 a service contract, mechanical or other insurance, or extended
  3 28 warranties sold for separate consideration to a consumer.

  2 17 or business entity that engages in the manufacturing of
  2 18 recreational vehicles.
  2 19    11.  "Manufacturer and dealer agreement" means a written
  2 20 agreement or contract entered into between a manufacturer
  2 21 or distributor and a dealer that fixes the rights and
  2 22 responsibilities of the parties and pursuant to which the
  2 23 dealer sells new recreational vehicles.
  2 24    12.  "Motor home" means the same as defined in section 321.1.
  2 25    13.  "Park model recreational vehicle" means a vehicle that
  2 26 is all of the following:
  2 27    a.  Designed and marketed primarily as temporary living
  2 28 quarters for recreational, camping, travel, or seasonal use.
  2 29    b.  Built on a single chassis mounted on wheels.
  2 30    c.  Has a gross trailer area not exceeding four hundred
  2 31 square feet in the set=up mode, and if less than three hundred
  2 32 twenty square feet in the set=up mode would require a special
  2 33 movement permit for highway transit.
  2 34    d.  Certified by the manufacturer as complying with the
  2 35 American national standards institute A119.5 park model
  3  1 recreational vehicle standard.
  3  2    14.  "Proprietary part" means any part manufactured by or for
  3  3 and sold exclusively by a manufacturer.
  3  4    15.  "Recreational vehicle" means a vehicle which is either
  3  5 self=propelled or towed by a consumer=owned vehicle, primarily
  3  6 designed to provide temporary living quarters for recreational,
  3  7 camping, or travel use that complies with all applicable
  3  8 federal vehicle regulations."Recreational vehicle" includes a
  3  9 "motor home" and a "travel trailer".
  3 10    16.  "Supplier" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 11 business entity that engages in the manufacture of recreational
  3 12 vehicle parts, accessories, or components.
  3 13    17.  "Transient consumer" means a consumer who is temporarily
  3 14 traveling through a dealer's area of sales responsibility.
  3 15    18.  "Travel trailer" means the same as defined in section
  3 16 321.1.  "Travel trailer" includes a fifth=wheel trailer, folding
  3 17 camping trailer, and a park model recreational vehicle, but
  3 18 does not include a vehicle that is so designed as to permit it
  3 19 to be towed exclusively by a motorcycle.
  3 20    19.  "Warrantor" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 21 business entity, including any manufacturer or supplier, that
  3 22 provides a written warranty to a consumer in connection with
  3 23 a new recreational vehicle or a part, accessory, or component
  3 24 of a new recreational vehicle.  "Warrantor" does not include
  3 25 a dealer, supplier, or other person, firm, corporation, or
  3 26 business entity not controlled by a manufacturer that provides
  3 27 a service contract, mechanical or other insurance, or extended
  3 28 warranties sold for separate consideration to a consumer.
  3 29    Sec. 2.    2 16    10.  "Manufacturer" means any person, firm, corporation,

  3 24 of a new recreational vehicle.  "Warrantor" does not include
  3 25 a dealer, supplier, or other person, firm, corporation, or
  3 26 business entity not controlled by a manufacturer that provides
  3 27 a service contract, mechanical or other insurance, or extended
  3 28 warranties sold for separate consideration to a consumer.
  3 29    Sec. 2.    2 26 is all of the following:
  2 27    a.  Designed and marketed primarily as temporary living
  2 28 quarters for recreational, camping, travel, or seasonal use.
  2 29    b.  Built on a single chassis mounted on wheels.
  2 30    c.  Has a gross trailer area not exceeding four hundred
  2 31 square feet in the set=up mode, and if less than three hundred
  2 32 twenty square feet in the set=up mode would require a special
  2 33 movement permit for highway transit.
  2 34    d.  Certified by the manufacturer as complying with the
  2 35 American national standards institute A119.5 park model
  3  1 recreational vehicle standard.

  3  8 federal vehicle regulations."Recreational vehicle" includes a

  3 26 business entity not controlled by a manufacturer that provides
  3 27 a service contract, mechanical or other insurance, or extended
  3 28 warranties sold for separate consideration to a consumer.
  3 29    Sec. 2.    3  6 designed to provide temporary living quarters for recreational,
  3  7 camping, or travel use that complies with all applicable
  3  8 federal vehicle regulations."Recreational vehicle" includes a
  3  9 "motor home" and a "travel trailer".
  3 10    16.  "Supplier" means any person, firm, corporation, or
  3 11 business entity that engages in the manufacture of recreational
  3 12 vehicle parts, accessories, or components.
  3 13    17.  "Transient consumer" means a consumer who is temporarily
  3 14 traveling through a dealer's area of sales responsibility.
  3 15    18.  "Travel trailer" means the same as defined in section
  3 16 321.1.  "Travel trailer" includes a fifth=wheel trailer, folding
  3 17 camping trailer, and a park model recreational vehicle, but
  3 18 does not include a vehicle that is so designed as to permit it
  3 19 to be towed exclusively by a motorcycle.

  3 21 business entity, including any manufacturer or supplier, that

  3 29    Sec. 2.    3 29    Sec. 2.    3 30 agreements == area of sales responsibility.
  3 31    1.  A manufacturer or distributor shall not sell a new
  3 32 recreational vehicle in this state to or through a dealer
  3 33 without first entering into a written manufacturer and dealer
  3 34 agreement with the dealer that has been signed by both parties.
  3 35 A dealer shall not sell a new recreational vehicle in this
  4  1 state without first entering into a written manufacturer and
  4  2 dealer agreement with a manufacturer or distributor that has
  4  3 been signed by both parties.
  4  4    2.  A manufacturer and dealer agreement shall designate the
  4  5 area of sales responsibility exclusively assigned to a dealer
  4  6 by the manufacturer or distributor and the manufacturer or
  4  7 distributor shall not change that area or contract with another
  4  8 dealer for sale of the same line=make in the designated area
  4  9 for the duration of the agreement.
  4 10    3.  The area of sales responsibility designated in a
  4 11 manufacturer and dealer agreement shall not be reviewed
  4 12 or changed until at least one year after execution of the
  4 13 agreement without the consent of both parties to the agreement.
  4 14    Sec. 3.    3 31    1.  A manufacturer or distributor shall not sell a new
  3 32 recreational vehicle in this state to or through a dealer

  3 34 agreement with the dealer that has been signed by both parties.

  4 14    Sec. 3.    4 13 agreement without the consent of both parties to the agreement.
  4 14    Sec. 3.    4 14    Sec. 3.    4 15 agreements == termination, cancellation, nonrenewal, and
  4 16 alteration.
  4 17    1.  Termination by manufacturer or distributor.
  4 18    a.  A manufacturer or distributor, directly or through any
  4 19 authorized officer, agent, or employee, may terminate, cancel,
  4 20 or fail to renew a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good
  4 21 cause.
  4 22    b.  If the manufacturer or distributor terminates, cancels,
  4 23 or fails to renew a manufacturer and dealer agreement with
  4 24 good cause, the manufacturer or distributor is not required to
  4 25 comply with the provisions of section 322E.4.
  4 26    c.  The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of showing
  4 27 good cause for terminating, canceling, or failing to renew a
  4 28 manufacturer and dealer agreement.  For purposes of determining
  4 29 whether good cause exists for such termination, cancellation,
  4 30 or nonrenewal of the agreement, any of the following factors
  4 31 may be considered:
  4 32    (1)  The extent of the affected dealer's penetration in the
  4 33 area of sales responsibility.
  4 34    (2)  The nature and extent of the dealer's investment in the
  4 35 dealer's business.
  5  1    (3)  The adequacy of the dealer's service facilities,
  5  2 equipment, parts, supplies, and personnel.
  5  3    (4)  The effect of the proposed termination, cancellation,
  5  4 or nonrenewal of the agreement on the community.
  5  5    (5)  The extent and quality of the dealer's service under the
  5  6 warranties of the recreational vehicles sold.
  5  7    (6)  The dealer's failure to follow agreed upon procedures or
  5  8 standards related to the overall operation of the dealership.
  5  9    (7)  The dealer's performance under the terms of the
  5 10 manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  5 11    d.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph
  5 12 "d", a manufacturer or distributor shall provide a dealer with
  5 13 at least ninety days' prior written notice of termination,
  5 14 cancellation, or nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer
  5 15 agreement.
  5 16    (2)  (a)  The notice shall state all of the reasons for the
  5 17 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal and shall further
  5 18 state that if, within thirty days following receipt of the
  5 19 notice, the dealer provides to the manufacturer or distributor
  5 20 a written notice of intent to cure all claimed deficiencies,
  5 21 the dealer shall then have ninety days following receipt of
  5 22 the notice to cure the deficiencies. If the dealer fails
  5 23 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies within
  5 24 thirty days following receipt of the notice,  the termination,
  5 25 cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause
  5 26 takes effect thirty days following the dealer's receipt of the
  5 27 notice.
  5 28    (b)  If the dealer provides notice of intent to cure the
  5 29 deficiencies stated and the deficiencies are cured by the
  5 30 dealer within ninety days following receipt of the notice,
  5 31 the manufacturer's or distributor's notice to the dealer is
  5 32 voided.  If the dealer provides notice of intent to cure the
  5 33 deficiencies stated and fails to cure the deficiencies within
  5 34 ninety days following receipt of the notice, the termination,
  5 35 cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause
  6  1 takes effect ninety days following the dealer's receipt of the
  6  2 notice.
  6  3    e.  Notwithstanding paragraph "d", the notice period for
  6  4 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer
  6  5 and dealer agreement for good cause may be reduced to thirty
  6  6 days if the grounds for such termination, cancellation, or
  6  7 nonrenewal are due to any of the following factors:
  6  8    (1)  The dealer or one of the dealer's owners has been
  6  9 convicted of or has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a
  6 10 felony.
  6 11    (2)  The dealer has abandoned or closed the dealer's business
  6 12 operations for ten consecutive business days, unless the
  6 13 closing is due to an act of God, a strike, a labor difficulty,
  6 14 or other cause over which the dealer has no control.
  6 15    (3)  The dealer has made a significant misrepresentation
  6 16 that materially affects the business relationship of the
  6 17 manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  6 18    (4)  The dealer's license has been suspended, revoked,
  6 19 denied, or not renewed.
  6 20    (5)  The dealer has committed a material violation of this
  6 21 chapter which is not cured within thirty days after receipt of
  6 22 written notice of the violation.
  6 23    f.  Notwithstanding paragraphs "d" and "e", the manufacturer
  6 24 and dealer agreement may be terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed
  6 25 for good cause at any time if the reason for the termination,
  6 26 cancellation, or nonrenewal is the dealer's insolvency, the
  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of
  6 28 creditors, or the dealer's declaration of bankruptcy.
  6 29    2.  Termination by dealer.
  6 30    a.  A dealer may terminate, cancel, or fail to renew a
  6 31 manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause.
  6 32    b.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or fails to renew
  6 33 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause, the
  6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    4 16 alteration.
  4 17    1.  Termination by manufacturer or distributor.
  4 18    a.  A manufacturer or distributor, directly or through any
  4 19 authorized officer, agent, or employee, may terminate, cancel,
  4 20 or fail to renew a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good
  4 21 cause.
  4 22    b.  If the manufacturer or distributor terminates, cancels,
  4 23 or fails to renew a manufacturer and dealer agreement with
  4 24 good cause, the manufacturer or distributor is not required to
  4 25 comply with the provisions of section 322E.4.
  4 26    c.  The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of showing
  4 27 good cause for terminating, canceling, or failing to renew a
  4 28 manufacturer and dealer agreement.  For purposes of determining
  4 29 whether good cause exists for such termination, cancellation,
  4 30 or nonrenewal of the agreement, any of the following factors
  4 31 may be considered:
  4 32    (1)  The extent of the affected dealer's penetration in the
  4 33 area of sales responsibility.
  4 34    (2)  The nature and extent of the dealer's investment in the
  4 35 dealer's business.
  5  1    (3)  The adequacy of the dealer's service facilities,
  5  2 equipment, parts, supplies, and personnel.
  5  3    (4)  The effect of the proposed termination, cancellation,
  5  4 or nonrenewal of the agreement on the community.
  5  5    (5)  The extent and quality of the dealer's service under the
  5  6 warranties of the recreational vehicles sold.
  5  7    (6)  The dealer's failure to follow agreed upon procedures or
  5  8 standards related to the overall operation of the dealership.
  5  9    (7)  The dealer's performance under the terms of the
  5 10 manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  5 11    d.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph
  5 12 "d", a manufacturer or distributor shall provide a dealer with
  5 13 at least ninety days' prior written notice of termination,
  5 14 cancellation, or nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer
  5 15 agreement.
  5 16    (2)  (a)  The notice shall state all of the reasons for the
  5 17 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal and shall further
  5 18 state that if, within thirty days following receipt of the
  5 19 notice, the dealer provides to the manufacturer or distributor
  5 20 a written notice of intent to cure all claimed deficiencies,
  5 21 the dealer shall then have ninety days following receipt of
  5 22 the notice to cure the deficiencies. If the dealer fails
  5 23 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies within
  5 24 thirty days following receipt of the notice,  the termination,
  5 25 cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause
  5 26 takes effect thirty days following the dealer's receipt of the
  5 27 notice.
  5 28    (b)  If the dealer provides notice of intent to cure the
  5 29 deficiencies stated and the deficiencies are cured by the
  5 30 dealer within ninety days following receipt of the notice,
  5 31 the manufacturer's or distributor's notice to the dealer is
  5 32 voided.  If the dealer provides notice of intent to cure the
  5 33 deficiencies stated and fails to cure the deficiencies within
  5 34 ninety days following receipt of the notice, the termination,
  5 35 cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause
  6  1 takes effect ninety days following the dealer's receipt of the
  6  2 notice.
  6  3    e.  Notwithstanding paragraph "d", the notice period for
  6  4 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer
  6  5 and dealer agreement for good cause may be reduced to thirty
  6  6 days if the grounds for such termination, cancellation, or
  6  7 nonrenewal are due to any of the following factors:
  6  8    (1)  The dealer or one of the dealer's owners has been
  6  9 convicted of or has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a
  6 10 felony.
  6 11    (2)  The dealer has abandoned or closed the dealer's business
  6 12 operations for ten consecutive business days, unless the
  6 13 closing is due to an act of God, a strike, a labor difficulty,
  6 14 or other cause over which the dealer has no control.
  6 15    (3)  The dealer has made a significant misrepresentation
  6 16 that materially affects the business relationship of the
  6 17 manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  6 18    (4)  The dealer's license has been suspended, revoked,
  6 19 denied, or not renewed.
  6 20    (5)  The dealer has committed a material violation of this
  6 21 chapter which is not cured within thirty days after receipt of
  6 22 written notice of the violation.
  6 23    f.  Notwithstanding paragraphs "d" and "e", the manufacturer
  6 24 and dealer agreement may be terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed
  6 25 for good cause at any time if the reason for the termination,
  6 26 cancellation, or nonrenewal is the dealer's insolvency, the
  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of
  6 28 creditors, or the dealer's declaration of bankruptcy.
  6 29    2.  Termination by dealer.
  6 30    a.  A dealer may terminate, cancel, or fail to renew a
  6 31 manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause.
  6 32    b.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or fails to renew
  6 33 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause, the
  6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    4 17    1.  Termination by manufacturer or distributor.
  4 18    a.  A manufacturer or distributor, directly or through any
  4 19 authorized officer, agent, or employee, may terminate, cancel,
  4 20 or fail to renew a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good
  4 21 cause.
  4 22    b.  If the manufacturer or distributor terminates, cancels,
  4 23 or fails to renew a manufacturer and dealer agreement with
  4 24 good cause, the manufacturer or distributor is not required to
  4 25 comply with the provisions of section 322E.4.
  4 26    c.  The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of showing
  4 27 good cause for terminating, canceling, or failing to renew a
  4 28 manufacturer and dealer agreement.  For purposes of determining
  4 29 whether good cause exists for such termination, cancellation,
  4 30 or nonrenewal of the agreement, any of the following factors
  4 31 may be considered:
  4 32    (1)  The extent of the affected dealer's penetration in the
  4 33 area of sales responsibility.
  4 34    (2)  The nature and extent of the dealer's investment in the
  4 35 dealer's business.
  5  1    (3)  The adequacy of the dealer's service facilities,
  5  2 equipment, parts, supplies, and personnel.
  5  3    (4)  The effect of the proposed termination, cancellation,
  5  4 or nonrenewal of the agreement on the community.
  5  5    (5)  The extent and quality of the dealer's service under the
  5  6 warranties of the recreational vehicles sold.
  5  7    (6)  The dealer's failure to follow agreed upon procedures or
  5  8 standards related to the overall operation of the dealership.
  5  9    (7)  The dealer's performance under the terms of the
  5 10 manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  5 11    d.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph
  5 12 "d", a manufacturer or distributor shall provide a dealer with
  5 13 at least ninety days' prior written notice of termination,
  5 14 cancellation, or nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer
  5 15 agreement.
  5 16    (2)  (a)  The notice shall state all of the reasons for the
  5 17 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal and shall further
  5 18 state that if, within thirty days following receipt of the
  5 19 notice, the dealer provides to the manufacturer or distributor
  5 20 a written notice of intent to cure all claimed deficiencies,
  5 21 the dealer shall then have ninety days following receipt of
  5 22 the notice to cure the deficiencies. If the dealer fails
  5 23 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies within
  5 24 thirty days following receipt of the notice,  the termination,
  5 25 cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause
  5 26 takes effect thirty days following the dealer's receipt of the
  5 27 notice.
  5 28    (b)  If the dealer provides notice of intent to cure the
  5 29 deficiencies stated and the deficiencies are cured by the
  5 30 dealer within ninety days following receipt of the notice,
  5 31 the manufacturer's or distributor's notice to the dealer is
  5 32 voided.  If the dealer provides notice of intent to cure the
  5 33 deficiencies stated and fails to cure the deficiencies within
  5 34 ninety days following receipt of the notice, the termination,
  5 35 cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause
  6  1 takes effect ninety days following the dealer's receipt of the
  6  2 notice.
  6  3    e.  Notwithstanding paragraph "d", the notice period for
  6  4 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer
  6  5 and dealer agreement for good cause may be reduced to thirty
  6  6 days if the grounds for such termination, cancellation, or
  6  7 nonrenewal are due to any of the following factors:
  6  8    (1)  The dealer or one of the dealer's owners has been
  6  9 convicted of or has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a
  6 10 felony.
  6 11    (2)  The dealer has abandoned or closed the dealer's business
  6 12 operations for ten consecutive business days, unless the
  6 13 closing is due to an act of God, a strike, a labor difficulty,
  6 14 or other cause over which the dealer has no control.
  6 15    (3)  The dealer has made a significant misrepresentation
  6 16 that materially affects the business relationship of the
  6 17 manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  6 18    (4)  The dealer's license has been suspended, revoked,
  6 19 denied, or not renewed.
  6 20    (5)  The dealer has committed a material violation of this
  6 21 chapter which is not cured within thirty days after receipt of
  6 22 written notice of the violation.
  6 23    f.  Notwithstanding paragraphs "d" and "e", the manufacturer
  6 24 and dealer agreement may be terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed
  6 25 for good cause at any time if the reason for the termination,
  6 26 cancellation, or nonrenewal is the dealer's insolvency, the
  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of
  6 28 creditors, or the dealer's declaration of bankruptcy.
  6 29    2.  Termination by dealer.
  6 30    a.  A dealer may terminate, cancel, or fail to renew a
  6 31 manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause.
  6 32    b.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or fails to renew
  6 33 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause, the
  6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
