  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    5 33 deficiencies stated and fails to cure the deficiencies within
  5 34 ninety days following receipt of the notice, the termination,
  5 35 cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause
  6  1 takes effect ninety days following the dealer's receipt of the
  6  2 notice.
  6  3    e.  Notwithstanding paragraph "d", the notice period for
  6  4 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer
  6  5 and dealer agreement for good cause may be reduced to thirty
  6  6 days if the grounds for such termination, cancellation, or
  6  7 nonrenewal are due to any of the following factors:
  6  8    (1)  The dealer or one of the dealer's owners has been
  6  9 convicted of or has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a
  6 10 felony.
  6 11    (2)  The dealer has abandoned or closed the dealer's business
  6 12 operations for ten consecutive business days, unless the
  6 13 closing is due to an act of God, a strike, a labor difficulty,
  6 14 or other cause over which the dealer has no control.
  6 15    (3)  The dealer has made a significant misrepresentation
  6 16 that materially affects the business relationship of the
  6 17 manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  6 18    (4)  The dealer's license has been suspended, revoked,
  6 19 denied, or not renewed.
  6 20    (5)  The dealer has committed a material violation of this
  6 21 chapter which is not cured within thirty days after receipt of
  6 22 written notice of the violation.
  6 23    f.  Notwithstanding paragraphs "d" and "e", the manufacturer
  6 24 and dealer agreement may be terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed
  6 25 for good cause at any time if the reason for the termination,
  6 26 cancellation, or nonrenewal is the dealer's insolvency, the
  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of
  6 28 creditors, or the dealer's declaration of bankruptcy.
  6 29    2.  Termination by dealer.
  6 30    a.  A dealer may terminate, cancel, or fail to renew a
  6 31 manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause.
  6 32    b.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or fails to renew
  6 33 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause, the
  6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    5 34 ninety days following receipt of the notice, the termination,
  5 35 cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause
  6  1 takes effect ninety days following the dealer's receipt of the
  6  2 notice.
  6  3    e.  Notwithstanding paragraph "d", the notice period for
  6  4 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer
  6  5 and dealer agreement for good cause may be reduced to thirty
  6  6 days if the grounds for such termination, cancellation, or
  6  7 nonrenewal are due to any of the following factors:
  6  8    (1)  The dealer or one of the dealer's owners has been
  6  9 convicted of or has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a
  6 10 felony.
  6 11    (2)  The dealer has abandoned or closed the dealer's business
  6 12 operations for ten consecutive business days, unless the
  6 13 closing is due to an act of God, a strike, a labor difficulty,
  6 14 or other cause over which the dealer has no control.
  6 15    (3)  The dealer has made a significant misrepresentation
  6 16 that materially affects the business relationship of the
  6 17 manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  6 18    (4)  The dealer's license has been suspended, revoked,
  6 19 denied, or not renewed.
  6 20    (5)  The dealer has committed a material violation of this
  6 21 chapter which is not cured within thirty days after receipt of
  6 22 written notice of the violation.
  6 23    f.  Notwithstanding paragraphs "d" and "e", the manufacturer
  6 24 and dealer agreement may be terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed
  6 25 for good cause at any time if the reason for the termination,
  6 26 cancellation, or nonrenewal is the dealer's insolvency, the
  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of
  6 28 creditors, or the dealer's declaration of bankruptcy.
  6 29    2.  Termination by dealer.
  6 30    a.  A dealer may terminate, cancel, or fail to renew a
  6 31 manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause.
  6 32    b.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or fails to renew
  6 33 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause, the
  6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.

  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to

  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.

  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor

  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or

  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed

  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor

  6 25 for good cause at any time if the reason for the termination,
  6 26 cancellation, or nonrenewal is the dealer's insolvency, the
  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of
  6 28 creditors, or the dealer's declaration of bankruptcy.
  6 29    2.  Termination by dealer.
  6 30    a.  A dealer may terminate, cancel, or fail to renew a
  6 31 manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause.
  6 32    b.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or fails to renew
  6 33 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause, the
  6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    6  4 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer
  6  5 and dealer agreement for good cause may be reduced to thirty
  6  6 days if the grounds for such termination, cancellation, or
  6  7 nonrenewal are due to any of the following factors:
  6  8    (1)  The dealer or one of the dealer's owners has been
  6  9 convicted of or has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a
  6 10 felony.
  6 11    (2)  The dealer has abandoned or closed the dealer's business
  6 12 operations for ten consecutive business days, unless the
  6 13 closing is due to an act of God, a strike, a labor difficulty,
  6 14 or other cause over which the dealer has no control.
  6 15    (3)  The dealer has made a significant misrepresentation
  6 16 that materially affects the business relationship of the
  6 17 manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  6 18    (4)  The dealer's license has been suspended, revoked,
  6 19 denied, or not renewed.
  6 20    (5)  The dealer has committed a material violation of this
  6 21 chapter which is not cured within thirty days after receipt of
  6 22 written notice of the violation.
  6 23    f.  Notwithstanding paragraphs "d" and "e", the manufacturer
  6 24 and dealer agreement may be terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed
  6 25 for good cause at any time if the reason for the termination,
  6 26 cancellation, or nonrenewal is the dealer's insolvency, the
  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of
  6 28 creditors, or the dealer's declaration of bankruptcy.
  6 29    2.  Termination by dealer.
  6 30    a.  A dealer may terminate, cancel, or fail to renew a
  6 31 manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause.
  6 32    b.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or fails to renew
  6 33 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause, the
  6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or

  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,

  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    6  5 and dealer agreement for good cause may be reduced to thirty
  6  6 days if the grounds for such termination, cancellation, or
  6  7 nonrenewal are due to any of the following factors:
  6  8    (1)  The dealer or one of the dealer's owners has been

  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of

  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    6 10 felony.
  6 11    (2)  The dealer has abandoned or closed the dealer's business
  6 12 operations for ten consecutive business days, unless the
  6 13 closing is due to an act of God, a strike, a labor difficulty,
  6 14 or other cause over which the dealer has no control.
  6 15    (3)  The dealer has made a significant misrepresentation
  6 16 that materially affects the business relationship of the
  6 17 manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  6 18    (4)  The dealer's license has been suspended, revoked,
  6 19 denied, or not renewed.
  6 20    (5)  The dealer has committed a material violation of this
  6 21 chapter which is not cured within thirty days after receipt of
  6 22 written notice of the violation.
  6 23    f.  Notwithstanding paragraphs "d" and "e", the manufacturer
  6 24 and dealer agreement may be terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed
  6 25 for good cause at any time if the reason for the termination,
  6 26 cancellation, or nonrenewal is the dealer's insolvency, the
  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of
  6 28 creditors, or the dealer's declaration of bankruptcy.
  6 29    2.  Termination by dealer.
  6 30    a.  A dealer may terminate, cancel, or fail to renew a
  6 31 manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause.
  6 32    b.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or fails to renew
  6 33 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause, the
  6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if

  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    6 11    (2)  The dealer has abandoned or closed the dealer's business
  6 12 operations for ten consecutive business days, unless the
  6 13 closing is due to an act of God, a strike, a labor difficulty,

  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    6 17 manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  6 18    (4)  The dealer's license has been suspended, revoked,
  6 19 denied, or not renewed.
  6 20    (5)  The dealer has committed a material violation of this
  6 21 chapter which is not cured within thirty days after receipt of
  6 22 written notice of the violation.
  6 23    f.  Notwithstanding paragraphs "d" and "e", the manufacturer
  6 24 and dealer agreement may be terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed
  6 25 for good cause at any time if the reason for the termination,
  6 26 cancellation, or nonrenewal is the dealer's insolvency, the
  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of
  6 28 creditors, or the dealer's declaration of bankruptcy.
  6 29    2.  Termination by dealer.
  6 30    a.  A dealer may terminate, cancel, or fail to renew a
  6 31 manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause.
  6 32    b.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or fails to renew
  6 33 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause, the
  6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    6 18    (4)  The dealer's license has been suspended, revoked,
  6 19 denied, or not renewed.
  6 20    (5)  The dealer has committed a material violation of this
  6 21 chapter which is not cured within thirty days after receipt of
  6 22 written notice of the violation.
  6 23    f.  Notwithstanding paragraphs "d" and "e", the manufacturer
  6 24 and dealer agreement may be terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed
  6 25 for good cause at any time if the reason for the termination,
  6 26 cancellation, or nonrenewal is the dealer's insolvency, the
  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of
  6 28 creditors, or the dealer's declaration of bankruptcy.
  6 29    2.  Termination by dealer.
  6 30    a.  A dealer may terminate, cancel, or fail to renew a
  6 31 manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause.
  6 32    b.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or fails to renew
  6 33 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause, the
  6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or

  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.

  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.

  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if

  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    6 24 and dealer agreement may be terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed
  6 25 for good cause at any time if the reason for the termination,
  6 26 cancellation, or nonrenewal is the dealer's insolvency, the
  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of
  6 28 creditors, or the dealer's declaration of bankruptcy.
  6 29    2.  Termination by dealer.
  6 30    a.  A dealer may terminate, cancel, or fail to renew a
  6 31 manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause.
  6 32    b.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or fails to renew
  6 33 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause, the
  6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    6 25 for good cause at any time if the reason for the termination,
  6 26 cancellation, or nonrenewal is the dealer's insolvency, the
  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of
  6 28 creditors, or the dealer's declaration of bankruptcy.
  6 29    2.  Termination by dealer.
  6 30    a.  A dealer may terminate, cancel, or fail to renew a
  6 31 manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause.
  6 32    b.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or fails to renew
  6 33 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause, the
  6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    6 26 cancellation, or nonrenewal is the dealer's insolvency, the
  6 27 dealer's declaration of an assignment for the benefit of
  6 28 creditors, or the dealer's declaration of bankruptcy.
  6 29    2.  Termination by dealer.
  6 30    a.  A dealer may terminate, cancel, or fail to renew a

  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to

  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    6 33 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause, the
  6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    6 34 manufacturer is required to comply with the provisions of
  6 35 section 322E.4.
  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.

  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if

  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.

  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.

  7  1    c.  (1)  Except as otherwise provided in this paragraph "c",
  7  2 a dealer shall provide a manufacturer or distributor with at
  7  3 least ninety days' notice of termination, cancellation, or
  7  4 nonrenewal of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
  7  5    (2)  (a)  The dealer has the burden of showing good cause
  7  6 and the notice shall state all of the reasons for the proposed
  7  7 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal.  The notice shall
  7  8 further state that if, within thirty days following receipt
  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement

  7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor
  7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    7  9 of the notice, the manufacturer or distributor provides to
  7 10 the dealer a written notice of intent to cure all claimed
  7 11 deficiencies, the manufacturer or distributor shall then
  7 12 have ninety days following receipt of the notice to cure
  7 13 the deficiencies.  If the manufacturer or distributor fails
  7 14 to provide notice of intent to cure the deficiencies to the
  7 15 dealer within thirty days following receipt of the notice,
  7 16 the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement
  7 17 for good cause takes effect thirty days following the
  7 18 manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of the notice.
  7 19    (b)  If the deficiencies stated in the notice are cured by
  7 20 the manufacturer or distributor within ninety days following
  7 21 receipt of the notice, the dealer's notice to the manufacturer
  7 22 or distributor is voided.  If the manufacturer or distributor

  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or
  7 33 nonrenewal due to any of the following factors:
  7 34    (1)  The manufacturer or distributor has been convicted of or
  7 35 has entered a plea of nolo contendere to a felony.
  8  1    (2)  The business operations of the manufacturer or
  8  2 distributor have been abandoned or closed for ten consecutive
  8  3 business days, unless the closing is due to an act of God,
  8  4 a strike, a labor difficulty, or other cause over which the
  8  5 manufacturer or distributor has no control.
  8  6    (3)  The manufacturer or distributor has made a significant
  8  7 misrepresentation that materially affects the business
  8  8 relationship of the manufacturer or distributor and the dealer.
  8  9    (4)  The manufacturer or distributor has committed a
  8 10 material violation of this chapter which is not cured within
  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.
  8 15    Sec. 4.    7 23 provides notice of intent to cure the deficiencies stated and
  7 24 fails to cure the deficiencies within ninety days following
  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.
  7 29    d.  Notwithstanding paragraph "c", the notice period for
  7 30 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of a manufacturer and
  7 31 dealer agreement by a dealer may be reduced to thirty days if
  7 32 there is good cause for such termination, cancellation, or

  8 11 thirty days after receipt of written notice of the violation.
  8 12    (5)  The manufacturer or distributor has declared bankruptcy
  8 13 or insolvency, or an assignment for the benefit of creditors or
  8 14 bankruptcy has occurred.

  7 25 receipt of the notice, the termination, cancellation, or
  7 26 nonrenewal of the agreement for good cause takes effect ninety
  7 27 days following the manufacturer's or distributor's receipt of
  7 28 the notice.

  8 15    Sec. 4.    8 15    Sec. 4.    8 16 inventory.
  8 17    1.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or does not renew
  8 18 the manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause as
  8 19 provided in section 322E.3, subsection 2, and the manufacturer
  8 20 or distributor fails to provide notice of intent to cure the
  8 21 claimed deficiencies or fails to cure the claimed deficiencies
  8 22 as provided in section 322E.3, subsection 2, the manufacturer
  8 23 or distributor shall, at the dealer's option, and within
  8 24 forty=five days after termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal
  8 25 of the agreement, repurchase all of the following:
  8 26    a.  (1)  All new, untitled recreational vehicles that
  8 27 were acquired from the manufacturer or distributor within
  8 28 twelve months prior to the effective date of the notice of
  8 29 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement, that
  8 30 have not been used except for demonstration purposes, and that
  8 31 have not been altered or damaged, at one hundred percent of the
  8 32 net invoice cost, including transportation, less applicable
  8 33 rebates and discounts to the dealer.
  8 34    (2)  In the event that any of the recreational vehicles
  8 35 repurchased pursuant to this paragraph "a" are damaged, but
  9  1 do not trigger a consumer disclosure requirement, the amount
  9  2 due to the dealer shall be reduced by the cost to repair the
  9  3 vehicle.  Damage incurred prior to delivery to the dealer that
  9  4 was disclosed at the time of delivery does not disqualify
  9  5 repurchase  pursuant to this paragraph "a".
  9  6    b.  All undamaged accessories and proprietary parts sold
  9  7 to the dealer for resale within twelve months prior to the
  9  8 effective date of termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal
  9  9 of the agreement, if accompanied by the original invoice, at
  9 10 one hundred five percent of the original net price paid to the
  9 11 manufacturer or distributor, to compensate the dealer for the
  9 12 cost of handling, packing, and shipping the parts for return to
  9 13 the manufacturer or distributor.
  9 14    c.  All properly functioning diagnostic equipment, special
  9 15 tools, current signage, or other equipment and machinery
  9 16 that was purchased by the dealer upon the request of the
  9 17 manufacturer or distributor within five years prior to the
  9 18 effective date of the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal
  9 19 of the agreement, and that can no longer be used in the normal
  9 20 course of the dealer's ongoing business.
  9 21    2.  If recreational vehicles of a particular line=make
  9 22 are not returned or required to be returned by the dealer to
  9 23 the manufacturer or distributor pursuant to the terminated,
  9 24 canceled, or nonrenewed manufacturer and dealer agreement, the
  9 25 dealer may continue to sell all line=makes that were subject to
  9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes
  9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.
  9 28    Sec. 5.    8 17    1.  If the dealer terminates, cancels, or does not renew
  8 18 the manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause as
  8 19 provided in section 322E.3, subsection 2, and the manufacturer
  8 20 or distributor fails to provide notice of intent to cure the
  8 21 claimed deficiencies or fails to cure the claimed deficiencies
  8 22 as provided in section 322E.3, subsection 2, the manufacturer
  8 23 or distributor shall, at the dealer's option, and within
  8 24 forty=five days after termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal
  8 25 of the agreement, repurchase all of the following:
  8 26    a.  (1)  All new, untitled recreational vehicles that
  8 27 were acquired from the manufacturer or distributor within
  8 28 twelve months prior to the effective date of the notice of
  8 29 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement, that
  8 30 have not been used except for demonstration purposes, and that
  8 31 have not been altered or damaged, at one hundred percent of the
  8 32 net invoice cost, including transportation, less applicable
  8 33 rebates and discounts to the dealer.
  8 34    (2)  In the event that any of the recreational vehicles
  8 35 repurchased pursuant to this paragraph "a" are damaged, but
  9  1 do not trigger a consumer disclosure requirement, the amount
  9  2 due to the dealer shall be reduced by the cost to repair the
  9  3 vehicle.  Damage incurred prior to delivery to the dealer that
  9  4 was disclosed at the time of delivery does not disqualify
  9  5 repurchase  pursuant to this paragraph "a".
  9  6    b.  All undamaged accessories and proprietary parts sold
  9  7 to the dealer for resale within twelve months prior to the
  9  8 effective date of termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal
  9  9 of the agreement, if accompanied by the original invoice, at
  9 10 one hundred five percent of the original net price paid to the
  9 11 manufacturer or distributor, to compensate the dealer for the
  9 12 cost of handling, packing, and shipping the parts for return to
  9 13 the manufacturer or distributor.
  9 14    c.  All properly functioning diagnostic equipment, special
  9 15 tools, current signage, or other equipment and machinery
  9 16 that was purchased by the dealer upon the request of the
  9 17 manufacturer or distributor within five years prior to the
  9 18 effective date of the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal
  9 19 of the agreement, and that can no longer be used in the normal
  9 20 course of the dealer's ongoing business.
  9 21    2.  If recreational vehicles of a particular line=make
  9 22 are not returned or required to be returned by the dealer to
  9 23 the manufacturer or distributor pursuant to the terminated,
  9 24 canceled, or nonrenewed manufacturer and dealer agreement, the
  9 25 dealer may continue to sell all line=makes that were subject to
  9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes
  9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.
  9 28    Sec. 5.    8 18 the manufacturer and dealer agreement with good cause as
  8 19 provided in section 322E.3, subsection 2, and the manufacturer
  8 20 or distributor fails to provide notice of intent to cure the
  8 21 claimed deficiencies or fails to cure the claimed deficiencies
  8 22 as provided in section 322E.3, subsection 2, the manufacturer
  8 23 or distributor shall, at the dealer's option, and within
  8 24 forty=five days after termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal
  8 25 of the agreement, repurchase all of the following:
  8 26    a.  (1)  All new, untitled recreational vehicles that
  8 27 were acquired from the manufacturer or distributor within
  8 28 twelve months prior to the effective date of the notice of
  8 29 termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal of the agreement, that
  8 30 have not been used except for demonstration purposes, and that
  8 31 have not been altered or damaged, at one hundred percent of the
  8 32 net invoice cost, including transportation, less applicable
  8 33 rebates and discounts to the dealer.
  8 34    (2)  In the event that any of the recreational vehicles
  8 35 repurchased pursuant to this paragraph "a" are damaged, but
  9  1 do not trigger a consumer disclosure requirement, the amount
  9  2 due to the dealer shall be reduced by the cost to repair the
  9  3 vehicle.  Damage incurred prior to delivery to the dealer that
  9  4 was disclosed at the time of delivery does not disqualify
  9  5 repurchase  pursuant to this paragraph "a".
  9  6    b.  All undamaged accessories and proprietary parts sold
  9  7 to the dealer for resale within twelve months prior to the
  9  8 effective date of termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal
  9  9 of the agreement, if accompanied by the original invoice, at
  9 10 one hundred five percent of the original net price paid to the
  9 11 manufacturer or distributor, to compensate the dealer for the
  9 12 cost of handling, packing, and shipping the parts for return to
  9 13 the manufacturer or distributor.
  9 14    c.  All properly functioning diagnostic equipment, special
  9 15 tools, current signage, or other equipment and machinery
  9 16 that was purchased by the dealer upon the request of the
  9 17 manufacturer or distributor within five years prior to the
  9 18 effective date of the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal
  9 19 of the agreement, and that can no longer be used in the normal
  9 20 course of the dealer's ongoing business.
  9 21    2.  If recreational vehicles of a particular line=make
  9 22 are not returned or required to be returned by the dealer to
  9 23 the manufacturer or distributor pursuant to the terminated,
  9 24 canceled, or nonrenewed manufacturer and dealer agreement, the
  9 25 dealer may continue to sell all line=makes that were subject to
  9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes
  9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.

  9  3 vehicle.  Damage incurred prior to delivery to the dealer that
  9  4 was disclosed at the time of delivery does not disqualify
  9  5 repurchase  pursuant to this paragraph "a".
  9  6    b.  All undamaged accessories and proprietary parts sold
  9  7 to the dealer for resale within twelve months prior to the
  9  8 effective date of termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal
  9  9 of the agreement, if accompanied by the original invoice, at
  9 10 one hundred five percent of the original net price paid to the
  9 11 manufacturer or distributor, to compensate the dealer for the
  9 12 cost of handling, packing, and shipping the parts for return to
  9 13 the manufacturer or distributor.
  9 14    c.  All properly functioning diagnostic equipment, special
  9 15 tools, current signage, or other equipment and machinery
  9 16 that was purchased by the dealer upon the request of the
  9 17 manufacturer or distributor within five years prior to the
  9 18 effective date of the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal
  9 19 of the agreement, and that can no longer be used in the normal
  9 20 course of the dealer's ongoing business.
  9 21    2.  If recreational vehicles of a particular line=make
  9 22 are not returned or required to be returned by the dealer to
  9 23 the manufacturer or distributor pursuant to the terminated,
  9 24 canceled, or nonrenewed manufacturer and dealer agreement, the
  9 25 dealer may continue to sell all line=makes that were subject to
  9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes
  9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.

  9 19 of the agreement, and that can no longer be used in the normal
  9 20 course of the dealer's ongoing business.
  9 21    2.  If recreational vehicles of a particular line=make
  9 22 are not returned or required to be returned by the dealer to
  9 23 the manufacturer or distributor pursuant to the terminated,
  9 24 canceled, or nonrenewed manufacturer and dealer agreement, the
  9 25 dealer may continue to sell all line=makes that were subject to
  9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes
  9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.
  9 28    Sec. 5.    9 18 effective date of the termination, cancellation, or nonrenewal
  9 19 of the agreement, and that can no longer be used in the normal
  9 20 course of the dealer's ongoing business.
  9 21    2.  If recreational vehicles of a particular line=make
  9 22 are not returned or required to be returned by the dealer to
  9 23 the manufacturer or distributor pursuant to the terminated,
  9 24 canceled, or nonrenewed manufacturer and dealer agreement, the
  9 25 dealer may continue to sell all line=makes that were subject to
  9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes
  9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.
  9 28    Sec. 5.    9 19 of the agreement, and that can no longer be used in the normal
  9 20 course of the dealer's ongoing business.
  9 21    2.  If recreational vehicles of a particular line=make
  9 22 are not returned or required to be returned by the dealer to
  9 23 the manufacturer or distributor pursuant to the terminated,
  9 24 canceled, or nonrenewed manufacturer and dealer agreement, the
  9 25 dealer may continue to sell all line=makes that were subject to
  9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes
  9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.
  9 28    Sec. 5.    9 20 course of the dealer's ongoing business.
  9 21    2.  If recreational vehicles of a particular line=make
  9 22 are not returned or required to be returned by the dealer to
  9 23 the manufacturer or distributor pursuant to the terminated,
  9 24 canceled, or nonrenewed manufacturer and dealer agreement, the
  9 25 dealer may continue to sell all line=makes that were subject to
  9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes
  9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.
  9 28    Sec. 5.    9 21    2.  If recreational vehicles of a particular line=make
  9 22 are not returned or required to be returned by the dealer to
  9 23 the manufacturer or distributor pursuant to the terminated,
  9 24 canceled, or nonrenewed manufacturer and dealer agreement, the
  9 25 dealer may continue to sell all line=makes that were subject to
  9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes
  9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.

  9 23 the manufacturer or distributor pursuant to the terminated,

  9 25 dealer may continue to sell all line=makes that were subject to
  9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes

  9 24 canceled, or nonrenewed manufacturer and dealer agreement, the
  9 25 dealer may continue to sell all line=makes that were subject to
  9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes
  9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.
