  9 25 dealer may continue to sell all line=makes that were subject to
  9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes
  9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.
  9 28    Sec. 5.    9 25 dealer may continue to sell all line=makes that were subject to
  9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes
  9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.
  9 28    Sec. 5.    9 26 the agreement and are currently in stock until those line=makes
  9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.
  9 28    Sec. 5.    9 27 are no longer in the dealer's inventory.
  9 28    Sec. 5.    9 28    Sec. 5.    9 29 succession == objections.
  9 30    1.  a.  If a dealer desires to make a change in ownership
  9 31 of a dealership by sale of the business assets, a stock
  9 32 transfer, or otherwise, the dealer shall give the manufacturer
  9 33 or distributor that is a party to a manufacturer and dealer
  9 34 agreement written notice of the proposed change at least
  9 35 fifteen business days before the change is effective, including
 10  1 all supporting documentation as may be reasonably required by
 10  2 the manufacturer or distributor to determine whether to make an
 10  3 objection to the sale, transfer, or other change in ownership.
 10  4 In the absence of a breach by the dealer of the manufacturer
 10  5 and dealer agreement or a violation of this chapter, the
 10  6 manufacturer or distributor shall not object to the proposed
 10  7 change in ownership unless the objection to the prospective
 10  8 transferee is due to any of the following factors:
 10  9    (1)  The transferee has previously been a party to a
 10 10 manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 10 11 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 10 12 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 10 13    (2)  The transferee has been convicted of a felony or any
 10 14 crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 10 15    (3)  The transferee lacks any license required by law.
 10 16    (4)  The transferee does not have an active line of credit
 10 17 sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or distributor's
 10 18 products.
 10 19    (5)  The transferee has undergone bankruptcy, insolvency,
 10 20 a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or the
 10 21 appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to take
 10 22 possession of the transferee's business or property within the
 10 23 previous ten years.
 10 24    b.  If a manufacturer or distributor objects to a proposed
 10 25 change in ownership of a dealership, the manufacturer or
 10 26 distributor shall give written notice of its reasons for the
 10 27 objection to the dealer within ten business days after receipt
 10 28 of the dealer's notification and supporting documentation of
 10 29 the proposed change.  The manufacturer or distributor has
 10 30 the burden of proof to show that its objection complies with
 10 31 the requirements of this subsection.  If the manufacturer or
 10 32 distributor does not give the dealer timely notice of its
 10 33 objection, the proposed change in ownership of the dealership
 10 34 shall be deemed approved.
 10 35    2.  a.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 11  1 fail to provide a dealer with the opportunity to designate,
 11  2 in writing, a family member as a successor to ownership of
 11  3 the dealership in the event of the death, incapacity, or
 11  4 retirement of the dealer. If a dealer desires to designate
 11  5 a family member as a successor to a dealership, the dealer
 11  6 shall give the manufacturer or distributor that is a party
 11  7 to the manufacturer and dealer agreement with the dealer
 11  8 written notice of the proposed designation or modification of
 11  9 a previous designation  at least fifteen business days before
 11 10 the designation or proposed modification of a designation is
 11 11 effective, including all supporting documentation as may be
 11 12 reasonably required by the manufacturer or distributor to
 11 13 determine whether to make an objection to the succession plan.
 11 14 In the absence of a breach by the dealer of the manufacturer
 11 15 and dealer agreement or a violation of this chapter, the
 11 16 manufacturer or distributor shall not object to the designated
 11 17 successor unless the objection is due to any of the following
 11 18 factors:
 11 19    (1)  The designated successor has previously been a party to
 11 20 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 11 21 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 11 22 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 11 23    (2)  The designated successor has been convicted of a felony
 11 24 or any crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 11 25    (3)  The designated successor lacks any license required by
 11 26 law at the time of succession.
 11 27    (4)  The designated successor does not have an active
 11 28 line of credit sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or
 11 29 distributor's products at the time of succession.
 11 30    (5)  The designated successor has undergone bankruptcy,
 11 31 insolvency, a general assignment for the benefit of creditors,
 11 32 or the appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to
 11 33 take possession of the designated successor's business or
 11 34 property within the previous ten years.
 11 35    b.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 12  1 prevent or refuse to honor the succession of a designated
 12  2 family member to ownership of a dealership when the dealer
 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.    9 30    1.  a.  If a dealer desires to make a change in ownership
  9 31 of a dealership by sale of the business assets, a stock
  9 32 transfer, or otherwise, the dealer shall give the manufacturer
  9 33 or distributor that is a party to a manufacturer and dealer
  9 34 agreement written notice of the proposed change at least
  9 35 fifteen business days before the change is effective, including
 10  1 all supporting documentation as may be reasonably required by
 10  2 the manufacturer or distributor to determine whether to make an
 10  3 objection to the sale, transfer, or other change in ownership.
 10  4 In the absence of a breach by the dealer of the manufacturer
 10  5 and dealer agreement or a violation of this chapter, the
 10  6 manufacturer or distributor shall not object to the proposed
 10  7 change in ownership unless the objection to the prospective
 10  8 transferee is due to any of the following factors:
 10  9    (1)  The transferee has previously been a party to a
 10 10 manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 10 11 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 10 12 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 10 13    (2)  The transferee has been convicted of a felony or any
 10 14 crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 10 15    (3)  The transferee lacks any license required by law.
 10 16    (4)  The transferee does not have an active line of credit
 10 17 sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or distributor's
 10 18 products.
 10 19    (5)  The transferee has undergone bankruptcy, insolvency,
 10 20 a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or the
 10 21 appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to take
 10 22 possession of the transferee's business or property within the
 10 23 previous ten years.
 10 24    b.  If a manufacturer or distributor objects to a proposed
 10 25 change in ownership of a dealership, the manufacturer or
 10 26 distributor shall give written notice of its reasons for the
 10 27 objection to the dealer within ten business days after receipt

 10 29 the proposed change.  The manufacturer or distributor has
 10 30 the burden of proof to show that its objection complies with
 10 31 the requirements of this subsection.  If the manufacturer or
 10 32 distributor does not give the dealer timely notice of its
 10 33 objection, the proposed change in ownership of the dealership
 10 34 shall be deemed approved.

 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be

 11 29 distributor's products at the time of succession.
 11 30    (5)  The designated successor has undergone bankruptcy,
 11 31 insolvency, a general assignment for the benefit of creditors,
 11 32 or the appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to
 11 33 take possession of the designated successor's business or
 11 34 property within the previous ten years.
 11 35    b.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 12  1 prevent or refuse to honor the succession of a designated
 12  2 family member to ownership of a dealership when the dealer
 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.    9 34 agreement written notice of the proposed change at least
  9 35 fifteen business days before the change is effective, including
 10  1 all supporting documentation as may be reasonably required by
 10  2 the manufacturer or distributor to determine whether to make an
 10  3 objection to the sale, transfer, or other change in ownership.
 10  4 In the absence of a breach by the dealer of the manufacturer
 10  5 and dealer agreement or a violation of this chapter, the
 10  6 manufacturer or distributor shall not object to the proposed
 10  7 change in ownership unless the objection to the prospective
 10  8 transferee is due to any of the following factors:
 10  9    (1)  The transferee has previously been a party to a
 10 10 manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 10 11 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 10 12 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 10 13    (2)  The transferee has been convicted of a felony or any
 10 14 crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 10 15    (3)  The transferee lacks any license required by law.
 10 16    (4)  The transferee does not have an active line of credit
 10 17 sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or distributor's
 10 18 products.
 10 19    (5)  The transferee has undergone bankruptcy, insolvency,
 10 20 a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or the
 10 21 appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to take
 10 22 possession of the transferee's business or property within the
 10 23 previous ten years.
 10 24    b.  If a manufacturer or distributor objects to a proposed
 10 25 change in ownership of a dealership, the manufacturer or
 10 26 distributor shall give written notice of its reasons for the
 10 27 objection to the dealer within ten business days after receipt
 10 28 of the dealer's notification and supporting documentation of
 10 29 the proposed change.  The manufacturer or distributor has
 10 30 the burden of proof to show that its objection complies with
 10 31 the requirements of this subsection.  If the manufacturer or
 10 32 distributor does not give the dealer timely notice of its
 10 33 objection, the proposed change in ownership of the dealership
 10 34 shall be deemed approved.
 10 35    2.  a.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 11  1 fail to provide a dealer with the opportunity to designate,
 11  2 in writing, a family member as a successor to ownership of
 11  3 the dealership in the event of the death, incapacity, or
 11  4 retirement of the dealer. If a dealer desires to designate
 11  5 a family member as a successor to a dealership, the dealer
 11  6 shall give the manufacturer or distributor that is a party
 11  7 to the manufacturer and dealer agreement with the dealer
 11  8 written notice of the proposed designation or modification of
 11  9 a previous designation  at least fifteen business days before
 11 10 the designation or proposed modification of a designation is
 11 11 effective, including all supporting documentation as may be
 11 12 reasonably required by the manufacturer or distributor to
 11 13 determine whether to make an objection to the succession plan.
 11 14 In the absence of a breach by the dealer of the manufacturer
 11 15 and dealer agreement or a violation of this chapter, the
 11 16 manufacturer or distributor shall not object to the designated
 11 17 successor unless the objection is due to any of the following
 11 18 factors:
 11 19    (1)  The designated successor has previously been a party to
 11 20 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 11 21 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 11 22 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 11 23    (2)  The designated successor has been convicted of a felony
 11 24 or any crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 11 25    (3)  The designated successor lacks any license required by
 11 26 law at the time of succession.
 11 27    (4)  The designated successor does not have an active
 11 28 line of credit sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or
 11 29 distributor's products at the time of succession.
 11 30    (5)  The designated successor has undergone bankruptcy,
 11 31 insolvency, a general assignment for the benefit of creditors,
 11 32 or the appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to
 11 33 take possession of the designated successor's business or
 11 34 property within the previous ten years.

 11 11 effective, including all supporting documentation as may be
 11 12 reasonably required by the manufacturer or distributor to
 11 13 determine whether to make an objection to the succession plan.
 11 14 In the absence of a breach by the dealer of the manufacturer
 11 15 and dealer agreement or a violation of this chapter, the
 11 16 manufacturer or distributor shall not object to the designated
 11 17 successor unless the objection is due to any of the following
 11 18 factors:
 11 19    (1)  The designated successor has previously been a party to
 11 20 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 11 21 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 11 22 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 11 23    (2)  The designated successor has been convicted of a felony
 11 24 or any crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 11 25    (3)  The designated successor lacks any license required by
 11 26 law at the time of succession.
 11 27    (4)  The designated successor does not have an active
 11 28 line of credit sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or
 11 29 distributor's products at the time of succession.
 11 30    (5)  The designated successor has undergone bankruptcy,
 11 31 insolvency, a general assignment for the benefit of creditors,
 11 32 or the appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to
 11 33 take possession of the designated successor's business or
 11 34 property within the previous ten years.
 11 35    b.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 12  1 prevent or refuse to honor the succession of a designated
 12  2 family member to ownership of a dealership when the dealer
 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   10  5 and dealer agreement or a violation of this chapter, the
 10  6 manufacturer or distributor shall not object to the proposed
 10  7 change in ownership unless the objection to the prospective
 10  8 transferee is due to any of the following factors:
 10  9    (1)  The transferee has previously been a party to a
 10 10 manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 10 11 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 10 12 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 10 13    (2)  The transferee has been convicted of a felony or any
 10 14 crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 10 15    (3)  The transferee lacks any license required by law.
 10 16    (4)  The transferee does not have an active line of credit
 10 17 sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or distributor's
 10 18 products.
 10 19    (5)  The transferee has undergone bankruptcy, insolvency,
 10 20 a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or the
 10 21 appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to take
 10 22 possession of the transferee's business or property within the
 10 23 previous ten years.
 10 24    b.  If a manufacturer or distributor objects to a proposed
 10 25 change in ownership of a dealership, the manufacturer or
 10 26 distributor shall give written notice of its reasons for the
 10 27 objection to the dealer within ten business days after receipt
 10 28 of the dealer's notification and supporting documentation of
 10 29 the proposed change.  The manufacturer or distributor has
 10 30 the burden of proof to show that its objection complies with
 10 31 the requirements of this subsection.  If the manufacturer or
 10 32 distributor does not give the dealer timely notice of its
 10 33 objection, the proposed change in ownership of the dealership
 10 34 shall be deemed approved.
 10 35    2.  a.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 11  1 fail to provide a dealer with the opportunity to designate,
 11  2 in writing, a family member as a successor to ownership of
 11  3 the dealership in the event of the death, incapacity, or
 11  4 retirement of the dealer. If a dealer desires to designate
 11  5 a family member as a successor to a dealership, the dealer
 11  6 shall give the manufacturer or distributor that is a party
 11  7 to the manufacturer and dealer agreement with the dealer
 11  8 written notice of the proposed designation or modification of
 11  9 a previous designation  at least fifteen business days before
 11 10 the designation or proposed modification of a designation is
 11 11 effective, including all supporting documentation as may be
 11 12 reasonably required by the manufacturer or distributor to
 11 13 determine whether to make an objection to the succession plan.

 11 33 take possession of the designated successor's business or
 11 34 property within the previous ten years.
 11 35    b.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 12  1 prevent or refuse to honor the succession of a designated
 12  2 family member to ownership of a dealership when the dealer
 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   10 11 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 10 12 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 10 13    (2)  The transferee has been convicted of a felony or any
 10 14 crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 10 15    (3)  The transferee lacks any license required by law.
 10 16    (4)  The transferee does not have an active line of credit
 10 17 sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or distributor's
 10 18 products.
 10 19    (5)  The transferee has undergone bankruptcy, insolvency,
 10 20 a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or the
 10 21 appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to take
 10 22 possession of the transferee's business or property within the
 10 23 previous ten years.
 10 24    b.  If a manufacturer or distributor objects to a proposed
 10 25 change in ownership of a dealership, the manufacturer or
 10 26 distributor shall give written notice of its reasons for the
 10 27 objection to the dealer within ten business days after receipt
 10 28 of the dealer's notification and supporting documentation of
 10 29 the proposed change.  The manufacturer or distributor has
 10 30 the burden of proof to show that its objection complies with
 10 31 the requirements of this subsection.  If the manufacturer or
 10 32 distributor does not give the dealer timely notice of its
 10 33 objection, the proposed change in ownership of the dealership
 10 34 shall be deemed approved.
 10 35    2.  a.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 11  1 fail to provide a dealer with the opportunity to designate,
 11  2 in writing, a family member as a successor to ownership of
 11  3 the dealership in the event of the death, incapacity, or
 11  4 retirement of the dealer. If a dealer desires to designate
 11  5 a family member as a successor to a dealership, the dealer
 11  6 shall give the manufacturer or distributor that is a party
 11  7 to the manufacturer and dealer agreement with the dealer
 11  8 written notice of the proposed designation or modification of
 11  9 a previous designation  at least fifteen business days before
 11 10 the designation or proposed modification of a designation is
 11 11 effective, including all supporting documentation as may be
 11 12 reasonably required by the manufacturer or distributor to
 11 13 determine whether to make an objection to the succession plan.
 11 14 In the absence of a breach by the dealer of the manufacturer
 11 15 and dealer agreement or a violation of this chapter, the
 11 16 manufacturer or distributor shall not object to the designated
 11 17 successor unless the objection is due to any of the following
 11 18 factors:
 11 19    (1)  The designated successor has previously been a party to
 11 20 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 11 21 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 11 22 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 11 23    (2)  The designated successor has been convicted of a felony
 11 24 or any crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 11 25    (3)  The designated successor lacks any license required by
 11 26 law at the time of succession.
 11 27    (4)  The designated successor does not have an active
 11 28 line of credit sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or
 11 29 distributor's products at the time of succession.
 11 30    (5)  The designated successor has undergone bankruptcy,
 11 31 insolvency, a general assignment for the benefit of creditors,
 11 32 or the appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to
 11 33 take possession of the designated successor's business or
 11 34 property within the previous ten years.
 11 35    b.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 12  1 prevent or refuse to honor the succession of a designated
 12  2 family member to ownership of a dealership when the dealer
 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's

 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects

 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor

 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.

 11 15 and dealer agreement or a violation of this chapter, the
 11 16 manufacturer or distributor shall not object to the designated
 11 17 successor unless the objection is due to any of the following
 11 18 factors:
 11 19    (1)  The designated successor has previously been a party to
 11 20 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 11 21 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 11 22 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 11 23    (2)  The designated successor has been convicted of a felony
 11 24 or any crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 11 25    (3)  The designated successor lacks any license required by
 11 26 law at the time of succession.
 11 27    (4)  The designated successor does not have an active
 11 28 line of credit sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or
 11 29 distributor's products at the time of succession.
 11 30    (5)  The designated successor has undergone bankruptcy,
 11 31 insolvency, a general assignment for the benefit of creditors,
 11 32 or the appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to
 11 33 take possession of the designated successor's business or
 11 34 property within the previous ten years.
 11 35    b.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 12  1 prevent or refuse to honor the succession of a designated
 12  2 family member to ownership of a dealership when the dealer
 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   10 18 products.
 10 19    (5)  The transferee has undergone bankruptcy, insolvency,
 10 20 a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or the
 10 21 appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to take
 10 22 possession of the transferee's business or property within the
 10 23 previous ten years.
 10 24    b.  If a manufacturer or distributor objects to a proposed
 10 25 change in ownership of a dealership, the manufacturer or
 10 26 distributor shall give written notice of its reasons for the
 10 27 objection to the dealer within ten business days after receipt
 10 28 of the dealer's notification and supporting documentation of
 10 29 the proposed change.  The manufacturer or distributor has
 10 30 the burden of proof to show that its objection complies with
 10 31 the requirements of this subsection.  If the manufacturer or
 10 32 distributor does not give the dealer timely notice of its
 10 33 objection, the proposed change in ownership of the dealership
 10 34 shall be deemed approved.
 10 35    2.  a.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 11  1 fail to provide a dealer with the opportunity to designate,
 11  2 in writing, a family member as a successor to ownership of
 11  3 the dealership in the event of the death, incapacity, or
 11  4 retirement of the dealer. If a dealer desires to designate
 11  5 a family member as a successor to a dealership, the dealer
 11  6 shall give the manufacturer or distributor that is a party
 11  7 to the manufacturer and dealer agreement with the dealer
 11  8 written notice of the proposed designation or modification of
 11  9 a previous designation  at least fifteen business days before
 11 10 the designation or proposed modification of a designation is
 11 11 effective, including all supporting documentation as may be
 11 12 reasonably required by the manufacturer or distributor to
 11 13 determine whether to make an objection to the succession plan.
 11 14 In the absence of a breach by the dealer of the manufacturer
 11 15 and dealer agreement or a violation of this chapter, the
 11 16 manufacturer or distributor shall not object to the designated
 11 17 successor unless the objection is due to any of the following
 11 18 factors:
 11 19    (1)  The designated successor has previously been a party to
 11 20 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 11 21 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 11 22 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 11 23    (2)  The designated successor has been convicted of a felony
 11 24 or any crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 11 25    (3)  The designated successor lacks any license required by
 11 26 law at the time of succession.
 11 27    (4)  The designated successor does not have an active
 11 28 line of credit sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or
 11 29 distributor's products at the time of succession.
 11 30    (5)  The designated successor has undergone bankruptcy,
 11 31 insolvency, a general assignment for the benefit of creditors,
 11 32 or the appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to
 11 33 take possession of the designated successor's business or
 11 34 property within the previous ten years.
 11 35    b.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 12  1 prevent or refuse to honor the succession of a designated
 12  2 family member to ownership of a dealership when the dealer
 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   10 19    (5)  The transferee has undergone bankruptcy, insolvency,
 10 20 a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or the
 10 21 appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to take
 10 22 possession of the transferee's business or property within the
 10 23 previous ten years.
 10 24    b.  If a manufacturer or distributor objects to a proposed
 10 25 change in ownership of a dealership, the manufacturer or
 10 26 distributor shall give written notice of its reasons for the
 10 27 objection to the dealer within ten business days after receipt
 10 28 of the dealer's notification and supporting documentation of
 10 29 the proposed change.  The manufacturer or distributor has
 10 30 the burden of proof to show that its objection complies with
 10 31 the requirements of this subsection.  If the manufacturer or
 10 32 distributor does not give the dealer timely notice of its
 10 33 objection, the proposed change in ownership of the dealership
 10 34 shall be deemed approved.

 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   10 25 change in ownership of a dealership, the manufacturer or
 10 26 distributor shall give written notice of its reasons for the
 10 27 objection to the dealer within ten business days after receipt
 10 28 of the dealer's notification and supporting documentation of
 10 29 the proposed change.  The manufacturer or distributor has
 10 30 the burden of proof to show that its objection complies with
 10 31 the requirements of this subsection.  If the manufacturer or
 10 32 distributor does not give the dealer timely notice of its
 10 33 objection, the proposed change in ownership of the dealership
 10 34 shall be deemed approved.
 10 35    2.  a.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 11  1 fail to provide a dealer with the opportunity to designate,
 11  2 in writing, a family member as a successor to ownership of
 11  3 the dealership in the event of the death, incapacity, or
 11  4 retirement of the dealer. If a dealer desires to designate
 11  5 a family member as a successor to a dealership, the dealer
 11  6 shall give the manufacturer or distributor that is a party
 11  7 to the manufacturer and dealer agreement with the dealer
 11  8 written notice of the proposed designation or modification of
 11  9 a previous designation  at least fifteen business days before
 11 10 the designation or proposed modification of a designation is
 11 11 effective, including all supporting documentation as may be
 11 12 reasonably required by the manufacturer or distributor to
 11 13 determine whether to make an objection to the succession plan.
 11 14 In the absence of a breach by the dealer of the manufacturer
 11 15 and dealer agreement or a violation of this chapter, the
 11 16 manufacturer or distributor shall not object to the designated
 11 17 successor unless the objection is due to any of the following
 11 18 factors:
 11 19    (1)  The designated successor has previously been a party to
 11 20 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 11 21 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 11 22 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 11 23    (2)  The designated successor has been convicted of a felony
 11 24 or any crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 11 25    (3)  The designated successor lacks any license required by
 11 26 law at the time of succession.
 11 27    (4)  The designated successor does not have an active
 11 28 line of credit sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or
 11 29 distributor's products at the time of succession.
 11 30    (5)  The designated successor has undergone bankruptcy,
 11 31 insolvency, a general assignment for the benefit of creditors,
 11 32 or the appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to
 11 33 take possession of the designated successor's business or
 11 34 property within the previous ten years.
 11 35    b.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 12  1 prevent or refuse to honor the succession of a designated
 12  2 family member to ownership of a dealership when the dealer
 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   10 26 distributor shall give written notice of its reasons for the
 10 27 objection to the dealer within ten business days after receipt
 10 28 of the dealer's notification and supporting documentation of
 10 29 the proposed change.  The manufacturer or distributor has
 10 30 the burden of proof to show that its objection complies with
 10 31 the requirements of this subsection.  If the manufacturer or
 10 32 distributor does not give the dealer timely notice of its
 10 33 objection, the proposed change in ownership of the dealership
 10 34 shall be deemed approved.

 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.

 10 31 the requirements of this subsection.  If the manufacturer or

 11  6 shall give the manufacturer or distributor that is a party
 11  7 to the manufacturer and dealer agreement with the dealer
 11  8 written notice of the proposed designation or modification of
 11  9 a previous designation  at least fifteen business days before
 11 10 the designation or proposed modification of a designation is
 11 11 effective, including all supporting documentation as may be
 11 12 reasonably required by the manufacturer or distributor to
 11 13 determine whether to make an objection to the succession plan.
 11 14 In the absence of a breach by the dealer of the manufacturer
 11 15 and dealer agreement or a violation of this chapter, the
 11 16 manufacturer or distributor shall not object to the designated
 11 17 successor unless the objection is due to any of the following
 11 18 factors:
 11 19    (1)  The designated successor has previously been a party to
 11 20 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 11 21 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 11 22 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 11 23    (2)  The designated successor has been convicted of a felony
 11 24 or any crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 11 25    (3)  The designated successor lacks any license required by
 11 26 law at the time of succession.
 11 27    (4)  The designated successor does not have an active
 11 28 line of credit sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or
 11 29 distributor's products at the time of succession.
 11 30    (5)  The designated successor has undergone bankruptcy,
 11 31 insolvency, a general assignment for the benefit of creditors,
 11 32 or the appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to
 11 33 take possession of the designated successor's business or
 11 34 property within the previous ten years.
 11 35    b.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 12  1 prevent or refuse to honor the succession of a designated
 12  2 family member to ownership of a dealership when the dealer
 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   10 34 shall be deemed approved.
 10 35    2.  a.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 11  1 fail to provide a dealer with the opportunity to designate,
 11  2 in writing, a family member as a successor to ownership of
 11  3 the dealership in the event of the death, incapacity, or
 11  4 retirement of the dealer. If a dealer desires to designate
 11  5 a family member as a successor to a dealership, the dealer
 11  6 shall give the manufacturer or distributor that is a party
 11  7 to the manufacturer and dealer agreement with the dealer
 11  8 written notice of the proposed designation or modification of
 11  9 a previous designation  at least fifteen business days before
 11 10 the designation or proposed modification of a designation is
 11 11 effective, including all supporting documentation as may be
 11 12 reasonably required by the manufacturer or distributor to
 11 13 determine whether to make an objection to the succession plan.

 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not

 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may

 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,

 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.

 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   11  8 written notice of the proposed designation or modification of
 11  9 a previous designation  at least fifteen business days before
 11 10 the designation or proposed modification of a designation is
 11 11 effective, including all supporting documentation as may be
 11 12 reasonably required by the manufacturer or distributor to
 11 13 determine whether to make an objection to the succession plan.
 11 14 In the absence of a breach by the dealer of the manufacturer
 11 15 and dealer agreement or a violation of this chapter, the
 11 16 manufacturer or distributor shall not object to the designated
 11 17 successor unless the objection is due to any of the following
 11 18 factors:
 11 19    (1)  The designated successor has previously been a party to
 11 20 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 11 21 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 11 22 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 11 23    (2)  The designated successor has been convicted of a felony
 11 24 or any crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 11 25    (3)  The designated successor lacks any license required by
 11 26 law at the time of succession.
 11 27    (4)  The designated successor does not have an active
 11 28 line of credit sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or
 11 29 distributor's products at the time of succession.
 11 30    (5)  The designated successor has undergone bankruptcy,
 11 31 insolvency, a general assignment for the benefit of creditors,
 11 32 or the appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to
 11 33 take possession of the designated successor's business or
 11 34 property within the previous ten years.
 11 35    b.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 12  1 prevent or refuse to honor the succession of a designated
 12  2 family member to ownership of a dealership when the dealer
 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.

 12  2 family member to ownership of a dealership when the dealer
 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   11 20 a manufacturer and dealer agreement with the manufacturer or
 11 21 distributor that was terminated, canceled, or nonrenewed by the
 11 22 manufacturer or distributor for good cause.
 11 23    (2)  The designated successor has been convicted of a felony
 11 24 or any crime of fraud, deceit, or moral turpitude.
 11 25    (3)  The designated successor lacks any license required by
 11 26 law at the time of succession.
 11 27    (4)  The designated successor does not have an active
 11 28 line of credit sufficient to purchase the manufacturer's or
 11 29 distributor's products at the time of succession.
 11 30    (5)  The designated successor has undergone bankruptcy,
 11 31 insolvency, a general assignment for the benefit of creditors,
 11 32 or the appointment of a receiver, trustee, or conservator to
 11 33 take possession of the designated successor's business or
 11 34 property within the previous ten years.
 11 35    b.  It is unlawful for a manufacturer or distributor to
 12  1 prevent or refuse to honor the succession of a designated
 12  2 family member to ownership of a dealership when the dealer
 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.

 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   12  2 family member to ownership of a dealership when the dealer
 12  3 is deceased, incapacitated, or has retired, unless the
 12  4 manufacturer or distributor has provided to the dealer written
 12  5 notice of the manufacturer's or distributor's objections to
 12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.

 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects

 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   12  6 the succession within ten days after receipt of the dealer's
 12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   12  7 designation of a successor or modification of the dealer's
 12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   12  8 succession plan. If a manufacturer or distributor objects
 12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   12  9 to the proposed succession of a designated family member of
 12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.
 12 15 The manufacturer or distributor has the burden of proof to
 12 16 show that the objection complies with the requirements of
 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not
 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   12 10 the dealer to the dealership, the manufacturer or distributor
 12 11 shall give written notice of its reasons for the objection
 12 12 to the dealer within ten business days after receipt of the
 12 13 dealer's notification and supporting documentation of the
 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.

 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession

 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.

 12 14 proposed succession or modification of the  succession plan.

 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may

 12 18 give the dealer timely notice of its objection, the proposed
 12 19 succession plan for ownership of the dealership shall be
 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession

 12 17 this subsection.  If the manufacturer or distributor does not

 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may

 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession

 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and

 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.

 12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   12 20 deemed approved.  However, a family member of the dealer may
 12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   12 21 not succeed to ownership of the dealership if the succession
 12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   12 22 involves, without the manufacturer's or distributor's consent,
 12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   12 23 a relocation of the dealership or alteration of the terms and
 12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   12 24 conditions of the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 12 25    Sec. 6.   12 25    Sec. 6.   12 26    1.  A warrantor shall do all of the following:
 12 27    a.  Specify in writing to each dealer what obligations
 12 28 the dealer has, if any, for preparation and delivery of, and
 12 29 warranty services on, the warrantor's products.
 12 30    b.  Compensate the dealer for warranty services required of
 12 31 the dealer by the warrantor.
 12 32    c.  Provide the dealer with a schedule of compensation and
 12 33 time allowances for the performance of warranty services.  The
 12 34 schedule of compensation shall include reasonable compensation
 12 35 for diagnostic services performed as well as warranty services.
 13  1    2.  Time allowances for the diagnosis and performance of
 13  2 warranty services shall be reasonable for the service to
 13  3 be performed.  In determining what constitutes reasonable
 13  4 compensation under this section, the principle factors to be
 13  5 given consideration are the actual wage rates being paid by the
 13  6 dealer and the actual retail wage rates being charged by other
 13  7 dealers in the community in which the dealer is doing business.
 13  8 The compensation of a dealer for warranty services shall not be
 13  9 less than the lowest actual retail wage rates charged by the
 13 10 dealer for like nonwarranty services as long as such actual
 13 11 wage rates are reasonable.
 13 12    3.  A warrantor shall reimburse a dealer for any warranty
 13 13 part, accessory, or complete component at actual wholesale cost
 13 14 plus a minimum of a thirty percent handling charge, up to a
 13 15 maximum of one hundred fifty dollars and the cost, if any, of
 13 16 freight to return such part, component, or accessory to the
 13 17 warrantor.
 13 18    4.  Warranty audits of dealer records may be conducted by a
 13 19 warrantor within twelve months from the payment of a warranty
 13 20 claim, and dealer claims for warranty compensation shall not
 13 21 be denied except for cause, such as performance of nonwarranty
 13 22 repairs, material noncompliance with the warrantor's published
 13 23 policies and procedures, lack of material documentation, fraud,
 13 24 or misrepresentation.
 13 25    5.  A dealer shall submit claims for compensation for the
 13 26 performance of warranty services to the warrantor within
 13 27 forty=five days after completion of the warranty services.
 13 28    6.  A dealer shall immediately notify a warrantor verbally
 13 29 or in writing if the dealer is unable to perform diagnostic
 13 30 services and warranty services within ten days of receipt of a
 13 31 verbal or written complaint from a consumer.
 13 32    7.  A warrantor shall disapprove a claim submitted by
 13 33 a dealer for compensation for the performance of warranty
 13 34 services, in writing, within forty=five days after submission
 13 35 of the claim in the manner and form prescribed by the
 14  1 warrantor.   A claim not specifically disapproved as required
 14  2 by this subsection shall be deemed approved and shall be paid
 14  3 within sixty days of submission of the claim.
 14  4    8.  A warrantor shall not do any of the following:
 14  5    a.  Fail to perform any of the warrantor's obligations with
 14  6 respect to its warranted products.
 14  7    b.  Fail to include, in written notices of a factory campaign
 14  8 to recreational vehicle owners and dealers, the expected date
 14  9 by which necessary parts and equipment, including tires and
 14 10 chassis or chassis parts, will be available to dealers to
 14 11 perform the factory campaign work.  The warrantor may ship
 14 12 parts to a dealer to effect factory campaign work, and, if such
 14 13 parts are in excess of the dealer's requirements, the dealer
 14 14 may return unused, undamaged parts to the warrantor for credit
 14 15 after completion of the factory campaign.
 14 16    c.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers for authorized
 14 17 repairs effected by the dealer on merchandise damaged in
 14 18 manufacture or in transit to the dealer by a carrier designated
 14 19 by the warrantor, factory branch, distributor, or distributor
 14 20 branch.
 14 21    d.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers in accordance
 14 22 with the schedule of compensation provided to the dealer
 14 23 pursuant to this section if the warranty services for which
 14 24 compensation is claimed are performed in a timely and competent
 14 25 manner as required in this section.
 14 26    e.  Intentionally  misrepresent in any way to consumers that
 14 27 warranties with respect to the manufacture, performance, or
 14 28 design of recreational vehicles are made by the dealer as
 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.
 14 30    f.  Require the warrantor's dealers to make warranties to a
 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.
 14 33    9.  A dealer shall not do any of the following:
 14 34    a.  Fail to perform predelivery inspection functions in a
 14 35 competent and timely manner, as specified by the warrantor.
 15  1    b.  Fail to perform warranty services authorized by the
 15  2 warrantor in a competent and timely manner on any transient
 15  3 consumer's recreational vehicle of a line=make sold or serviced
 15  4 by that dealer.
 15  5    c.  Fail to accurately document the time spent completing
 15  6 each repair, the total number of repair attempts conducted on
 15  7 a single unit, and the number of repair attempts for the same
 15  8 repair conducted on a single recreational vehicle.
 15  9    d.  Fail to notify the warrantor within ten days of a second
 15 10 repair attempt on a recreational vehicle which impairs the use,
 15 11 value, or safety of the vehicle.
 15 12    e.  Fail to maintain written records, including a consumer's
 15 13 signature, regarding the amount of time a unit is stored for
 15 14 the consumer's convenience during a repair.
 15 15    f.  Make fraudulent warranty claims or misrepresent the terms
 15 16 of any warranty.
 15 17    Sec. 7.   12 27    a.  Specify in writing to each dealer what obligations
 12 28 the dealer has, if any, for preparation and delivery of, and
 12 29 warranty services on, the warrantor's products.
 12 30    b.  Compensate the dealer for warranty services required of
 12 31 the dealer by the warrantor.
 12 32    c.  Provide the dealer with a schedule of compensation and
 12 33 time allowances for the performance of warranty services.  The
 12 34 schedule of compensation shall include reasonable compensation
 12 35 for diagnostic services performed as well as warranty services.

 13  7 dealers in the community in which the dealer is doing business.

 13 11 wage rates are reasonable.

 14 28 design of recreational vehicles are made by the dealer as
 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.
 14 30    f.  Require the warrantor's dealers to make warranties to a
 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.

 14 34    a.  Fail to perform predelivery inspection functions in a
 14 35 competent and timely manner, as specified by the warrantor.
 15  1    b.  Fail to perform warranty services authorized by the
 15  2 warrantor in a competent and timely manner on any transient
 15  3 consumer's recreational vehicle of a line=make sold or serviced
 15  4 by that dealer.
 15  5    c.  Fail to accurately document the time spent completing
 15  6 each repair, the total number of repair attempts conducted on
 15  7 a single unit, and the number of repair attempts for the same

 15 11 value, or safety of the vehicle.
 15 12    e.  Fail to maintain written records, including a consumer's
 15 13 signature, regarding the amount of time a unit is stored for
 15 14 the consumer's convenience during a repair.
 15 15    f.  Make fraudulent warranty claims or misrepresent the terms
 15 16 of any warranty.
