 14  6 respect to its warranted products.
 14  7    b.  Fail to include, in written notices of a factory campaign
 14  8 to recreational vehicle owners and dealers, the expected date
 14  9 by which necessary parts and equipment, including tires and
 14 10 chassis or chassis parts, will be available to dealers to
 14 11 perform the factory campaign work.  The warrantor may ship
 14 12 parts to a dealer to effect factory campaign work, and, if such
 14 13 parts are in excess of the dealer's requirements, the dealer
 14 14 may return unused, undamaged parts to the warrantor for credit
 14 15 after completion of the factory campaign.
 14 16    c.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers for authorized
 14 17 repairs effected by the dealer on merchandise damaged in
 14 18 manufacture or in transit to the dealer by a carrier designated
 14 19 by the warrantor, factory branch, distributor, or distributor
 14 20 branch.
 14 21    d.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers in accordance
 14 22 with the schedule of compensation provided to the dealer
 14 23 pursuant to this section if the warranty services for which
 14 24 compensation is claimed are performed in a timely and competent
 14 25 manner as required in this section.
 14 26    e.  Intentionally  misrepresent in any way to consumers that
 14 27 warranties with respect to the manufacture, performance, or
 14 28 design of recreational vehicles are made by the dealer as
 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.
 14 30    f.  Require the warrantor's dealers to make warranties to a
 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.
 14 33    9.  A dealer shall not do any of the following:
 14 34    a.  Fail to perform predelivery inspection functions in a
 14 35 competent and timely manner, as specified by the warrantor.
 15  1    b.  Fail to perform warranty services authorized by the
 15  2 warrantor in a competent and timely manner on any transient
 15  3 consumer's recreational vehicle of a line=make sold or serviced
 15  4 by that dealer.
 15  5    c.  Fail to accurately document the time spent completing
 15  6 each repair, the total number of repair attempts conducted on
 15  7 a single unit, and the number of repair attempts for the same
 15  8 repair conducted on a single recreational vehicle.
 15  9    d.  Fail to notify the warrantor within ten days of a second
 15 10 repair attempt on a recreational vehicle which impairs the use,
 15 11 value, or safety of the vehicle.
 15 12    e.  Fail to maintain written records, including a consumer's
 15 13 signature, regarding the amount of time a unit is stored for
 15 14 the consumer's convenience during a repair.
 15 15    f.  Make fraudulent warranty claims or misrepresent the terms
 15 16 of any warranty.
 15 17    Sec. 7.   12 29 warranty services on, the warrantor's products.
 12 30    b.  Compensate the dealer for warranty services required of
 12 31 the dealer by the warrantor.
 12 32    c.  Provide the dealer with a schedule of compensation and
 12 33 time allowances for the performance of warranty services.  The
 12 34 schedule of compensation shall include reasonable compensation
 12 35 for diagnostic services performed as well as warranty services.
 13  1    2.  Time allowances for the diagnosis and performance of
 13  2 warranty services shall be reasonable for the service to
 13  3 be performed.  In determining what constitutes reasonable
 13  4 compensation under this section, the principle factors to be
 13  5 given consideration are the actual wage rates being paid by the
 13  6 dealer and the actual retail wage rates being charged by other
 13  7 dealers in the community in which the dealer is doing business.
 13  8 The compensation of a dealer for warranty services shall not be
 13  9 less than the lowest actual retail wage rates charged by the
 13 10 dealer for like nonwarranty services as long as such actual
 13 11 wage rates are reasonable.
 13 12    3.  A warrantor shall reimburse a dealer for any warranty
 13 13 part, accessory, or complete component at actual wholesale cost
 13 14 plus a minimum of a thirty percent handling charge, up to a
 13 15 maximum of one hundred fifty dollars and the cost, if any, of
 13 16 freight to return such part, component, or accessory to the
 13 17 warrantor.
 13 18    4.  Warranty audits of dealer records may be conducted by a
 13 19 warrantor within twelve months from the payment of a warranty
 13 20 claim, and dealer claims for warranty compensation shall not
 13 21 be denied except for cause, such as performance of nonwarranty
 13 22 repairs, material noncompliance with the warrantor's published
 13 23 policies and procedures, lack of material documentation, fraud,
 13 24 or misrepresentation.
 13 25    5.  A dealer shall submit claims for compensation for the
 13 26 performance of warranty services to the warrantor within
 13 27 forty=five days after completion of the warranty services.
 13 28    6.  A dealer shall immediately notify a warrantor verbally
 13 29 or in writing if the dealer is unable to perform diagnostic
 13 30 services and warranty services within ten days of receipt of a
 13 31 verbal or written complaint from a consumer.
 13 32    7.  A warrantor shall disapprove a claim submitted by
 13 33 a dealer for compensation for the performance of warranty
 13 34 services, in writing, within forty=five days after submission
 13 35 of the claim in the manner and form prescribed by the
 14  1 warrantor.   A claim not specifically disapproved as required
 14  2 by this subsection shall be deemed approved and shall be paid
 14  3 within sixty days of submission of the claim.
 14  4    8.  A warrantor shall not do any of the following:
 14  5    a.  Fail to perform any of the warrantor's obligations with
 14  6 respect to its warranted products.
 14  7    b.  Fail to include, in written notices of a factory campaign
 14  8 to recreational vehicle owners and dealers, the expected date
 14  9 by which necessary parts and equipment, including tires and
 14 10 chassis or chassis parts, will be available to dealers to
 14 11 perform the factory campaign work.  The warrantor may ship
 14 12 parts to a dealer to effect factory campaign work, and, if such
 14 13 parts are in excess of the dealer's requirements, the dealer
 14 14 may return unused, undamaged parts to the warrantor for credit
 14 15 after completion of the factory campaign.
 14 16    c.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers for authorized
 14 17 repairs effected by the dealer on merchandise damaged in
 14 18 manufacture or in transit to the dealer by a carrier designated
 14 19 by the warrantor, factory branch, distributor, or distributor
 14 20 branch.
 14 21    d.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers in accordance
 14 22 with the schedule of compensation provided to the dealer
 14 23 pursuant to this section if the warranty services for which
 14 24 compensation is claimed are performed in a timely and competent
 14 25 manner as required in this section.
 14 26    e.  Intentionally  misrepresent in any way to consumers that
 14 27 warranties with respect to the manufacture, performance, or
 14 28 design of recreational vehicles are made by the dealer as
 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.
 14 30    f.  Require the warrantor's dealers to make warranties to a
 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.
 14 33    9.  A dealer shall not do any of the following:
 14 34    a.  Fail to perform predelivery inspection functions in a
 14 35 competent and timely manner, as specified by the warrantor.
 15  1    b.  Fail to perform warranty services authorized by the
 15  2 warrantor in a competent and timely manner on any transient
 15  3 consumer's recreational vehicle of a line=make sold or serviced
 15  4 by that dealer.
 15  5    c.  Fail to accurately document the time spent completing
 15  6 each repair, the total number of repair attempts conducted on
 15  7 a single unit, and the number of repair attempts for the same
 15  8 repair conducted on a single recreational vehicle.
 15  9    d.  Fail to notify the warrantor within ten days of a second
 15 10 repair attempt on a recreational vehicle which impairs the use,
 15 11 value, or safety of the vehicle.
 15 12    e.  Fail to maintain written records, including a consumer's
 15 13 signature, regarding the amount of time a unit is stored for
 15 14 the consumer's convenience during a repair.
 15 15    f.  Make fraudulent warranty claims or misrepresent the terms
 15 16 of any warranty.
 15 17    Sec. 7.   12 30    b.  Compensate the dealer for warranty services required of
 12 31 the dealer by the warrantor.

 12 34 schedule of compensation shall include reasonable compensation
 12 35 for diagnostic services performed as well as warranty services.

 13 32    7.  A warrantor shall disapprove a claim submitted by
 13 33 a dealer for compensation for the performance of warranty
 13 34 services, in writing, within forty=five days after submission
 13 35 of the claim in the manner and form prescribed by the
 14  1 warrantor.   A claim not specifically disapproved as required
 14  2 by this subsection shall be deemed approved and shall be paid
 14  3 within sixty days of submission of the claim.
 14  4    8.  A warrantor shall not do any of the following:
 14  5    a.  Fail to perform any of the warrantor's obligations with
 14  6 respect to its warranted products.
 14  7    b.  Fail to include, in written notices of a factory campaign
 14  8 to recreational vehicle owners and dealers, the expected date
 14  9 by which necessary parts and equipment, including tires and
 14 10 chassis or chassis parts, will be available to dealers to
 14 11 perform the factory campaign work.  The warrantor may ship
 14 12 parts to a dealer to effect factory campaign work, and, if such
 14 13 parts are in excess of the dealer's requirements, the dealer
 14 14 may return unused, undamaged parts to the warrantor for credit
 14 15 after completion of the factory campaign.
 14 16    c.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers for authorized
 14 17 repairs effected by the dealer on merchandise damaged in
 14 18 manufacture or in transit to the dealer by a carrier designated
 14 19 by the warrantor, factory branch, distributor, or distributor
 14 20 branch.
 14 21    d.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers in accordance
 14 22 with the schedule of compensation provided to the dealer
 14 23 pursuant to this section if the warranty services for which
 14 24 compensation is claimed are performed in a timely and competent
 14 25 manner as required in this section.
 14 26    e.  Intentionally  misrepresent in any way to consumers that
 14 27 warranties with respect to the manufacture, performance, or
 14 28 design of recreational vehicles are made by the dealer as
 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.
 14 30    f.  Require the warrantor's dealers to make warranties to a
 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.
 14 33    9.  A dealer shall not do any of the following:
 14 34    a.  Fail to perform predelivery inspection functions in a
 14 35 competent and timely manner, as specified by the warrantor.
 15  1    b.  Fail to perform warranty services authorized by the
 15  2 warrantor in a competent and timely manner on any transient
 15  3 consumer's recreational vehicle of a line=make sold or serviced
 15  4 by that dealer.
 15  5    c.  Fail to accurately document the time spent completing
 15  6 each repair, the total number of repair attempts conducted on
 15  7 a single unit, and the number of repair attempts for the same
 15  8 repair conducted on a single recreational vehicle.
 15  9    d.  Fail to notify the warrantor within ten days of a second
 15 10 repair attempt on a recreational vehicle which impairs the use,
 15 11 value, or safety of the vehicle.
 15 12    e.  Fail to maintain written records, including a consumer's
 15 13 signature, regarding the amount of time a unit is stored for
 15 14 the consumer's convenience during a repair.
 15 15    f.  Make fraudulent warranty claims or misrepresent the terms
 15 16 of any warranty.
 15 17    Sec. 7.   12 35 for diagnostic services performed as well as warranty services.
 13  1    2.  Time allowances for the diagnosis and performance of
 13  2 warranty services shall be reasonable for the service to
 13  3 be performed.  In determining what constitutes reasonable
 13  4 compensation under this section, the principle factors to be
 13  5 given consideration are the actual wage rates being paid by the
 13  6 dealer and the actual retail wage rates being charged by other
 13  7 dealers in the community in which the dealer is doing business.
 13  8 The compensation of a dealer for warranty services shall not be
 13  9 less than the lowest actual retail wage rates charged by the
 13 10 dealer for like nonwarranty services as long as such actual
 13 11 wage rates are reasonable.
 13 12    3.  A warrantor shall reimburse a dealer for any warranty
 13 13 part, accessory, or complete component at actual wholesale cost
 13 14 plus a minimum of a thirty percent handling charge, up to a
 13 15 maximum of one hundred fifty dollars and the cost, if any, of
 13 16 freight to return such part, component, or accessory to the
 13 17 warrantor.
 13 18    4.  Warranty audits of dealer records may be conducted by a
 13 19 warrantor within twelve months from the payment of a warranty
 13 20 claim, and dealer claims for warranty compensation shall not
 13 21 be denied except for cause, such as performance of nonwarranty
 13 22 repairs, material noncompliance with the warrantor's published
 13 23 policies and procedures, lack of material documentation, fraud,
 13 24 or misrepresentation.
 13 25    5.  A dealer shall submit claims for compensation for the
 13 26 performance of warranty services to the warrantor within
 13 27 forty=five days after completion of the warranty services.
 13 28    6.  A dealer shall immediately notify a warrantor verbally
 13 29 or in writing if the dealer is unable to perform diagnostic
 13 30 services and warranty services within ten days of receipt of a
 13 31 verbal or written complaint from a consumer.
 13 32    7.  A warrantor shall disapprove a claim submitted by
 13 33 a dealer for compensation for the performance of warranty
 13 34 services, in writing, within forty=five days after submission
 13 35 of the claim in the manner and form prescribed by the
 14  1 warrantor.   A claim not specifically disapproved as required
 14  2 by this subsection shall be deemed approved and shall be paid
 14  3 within sixty days of submission of the claim.
 14  4    8.  A warrantor shall not do any of the following:
 14  5    a.  Fail to perform any of the warrantor's obligations with
 14  6 respect to its warranted products.
 14  7    b.  Fail to include, in written notices of a factory campaign
 14  8 to recreational vehicle owners and dealers, the expected date
 14  9 by which necessary parts and equipment, including tires and
 14 10 chassis or chassis parts, will be available to dealers to
 14 11 perform the factory campaign work.  The warrantor may ship
 14 12 parts to a dealer to effect factory campaign work, and, if such
 14 13 parts are in excess of the dealer's requirements, the dealer
 14 14 may return unused, undamaged parts to the warrantor for credit
 14 15 after completion of the factory campaign.
 14 16    c.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers for authorized
 14 17 repairs effected by the dealer on merchandise damaged in
 14 18 manufacture or in transit to the dealer by a carrier designated
 14 19 by the warrantor, factory branch, distributor, or distributor
 14 20 branch.
 14 21    d.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers in accordance
 14 22 with the schedule of compensation provided to the dealer
 14 23 pursuant to this section if the warranty services for which
 14 24 compensation is claimed are performed in a timely and competent
 14 25 manner as required in this section.
 14 26    e.  Intentionally  misrepresent in any way to consumers that
 14 27 warranties with respect to the manufacture, performance, or
 14 28 design of recreational vehicles are made by the dealer as
 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.
 14 30    f.  Require the warrantor's dealers to make warranties to a
 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.

 14 34    a.  Fail to perform predelivery inspection functions in a
 14 35 competent and timely manner, as specified by the warrantor.

 15  2 warrantor in a competent and timely manner on any transient

 15  4 by that dealer.

 14 22 with the schedule of compensation provided to the dealer
 14 23 pursuant to this section if the warranty services for which
 14 24 compensation is claimed are performed in a timely and competent
 14 25 manner as required in this section.
 14 26    e.  Intentionally  misrepresent in any way to consumers that
 14 27 warranties with respect to the manufacture, performance, or
 14 28 design of recreational vehicles are made by the dealer as
 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.
 14 30    f.  Require the warrantor's dealers to make warranties to a
 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.
 14 33    9.  A dealer shall not do any of the following:
 14 34    a.  Fail to perform predelivery inspection functions in a
 14 35 competent and timely manner, as specified by the warrantor.
 15  1    b.  Fail to perform warranty services authorized by the
 15  2 warrantor in a competent and timely manner on any transient
 15  3 consumer's recreational vehicle of a line=make sold or serviced
 15  4 by that dealer.
 15  5    c.  Fail to accurately document the time spent completing
 15  6 each repair, the total number of repair attempts conducted on
 15  7 a single unit, and the number of repair attempts for the same
 15  8 repair conducted on a single recreational vehicle.
 15  9    d.  Fail to notify the warrantor within ten days of a second
 15 10 repair attempt on a recreational vehicle which impairs the use,
 15 11 value, or safety of the vehicle.
 15 12    e.  Fail to maintain written records, including a consumer's
 15 13 signature, regarding the amount of time a unit is stored for
 15 14 the consumer's convenience during a repair.
 15 15    f.  Make fraudulent warranty claims or misrepresent the terms
 15 16 of any warranty.
 15 17    Sec. 7.   13  6 dealer and the actual retail wage rates being charged by other
 13  7 dealers in the community in which the dealer is doing business.
 13  8 The compensation of a dealer for warranty services shall not be
 13  9 less than the lowest actual retail wage rates charged by the
 13 10 dealer for like nonwarranty services as long as such actual
 13 11 wage rates are reasonable.
 13 12    3.  A warrantor shall reimburse a dealer for any warranty
 13 13 part, accessory, or complete component at actual wholesale cost
 13 14 plus a minimum of a thirty percent handling charge, up to a
 13 15 maximum of one hundred fifty dollars and the cost, if any, of
 13 16 freight to return such part, component, or accessory to the
 13 17 warrantor.
 13 18    4.  Warranty audits of dealer records may be conducted by a
 13 19 warrantor within twelve months from the payment of a warranty
 13 20 claim, and dealer claims for warranty compensation shall not
 13 21 be denied except for cause, such as performance of nonwarranty
 13 22 repairs, material noncompliance with the warrantor's published
 13 23 policies and procedures, lack of material documentation, fraud,
 13 24 or misrepresentation.
 13 25    5.  A dealer shall submit claims for compensation for the
 13 26 performance of warranty services to the warrantor within
 13 27 forty=five days after completion of the warranty services.
 13 28    6.  A dealer shall immediately notify a warrantor verbally
 13 29 or in writing if the dealer is unable to perform diagnostic
 13 30 services and warranty services within ten days of receipt of a
 13 31 verbal or written complaint from a consumer.
 13 32    7.  A warrantor shall disapprove a claim submitted by
 13 33 a dealer for compensation for the performance of warranty
 13 34 services, in writing, within forty=five days after submission
 13 35 of the claim in the manner and form prescribed by the
 14  1 warrantor.   A claim not specifically disapproved as required
 14  2 by this subsection shall be deemed approved and shall be paid
 14  3 within sixty days of submission of the claim.
 14  4    8.  A warrantor shall not do any of the following:
 14  5    a.  Fail to perform any of the warrantor's obligations with
 14  6 respect to its warranted products.
 14  7    b.  Fail to include, in written notices of a factory campaign
 14  8 to recreational vehicle owners and dealers, the expected date
 14  9 by which necessary parts and equipment, including tires and
 14 10 chassis or chassis parts, will be available to dealers to
 14 11 perform the factory campaign work.  The warrantor may ship
 14 12 parts to a dealer to effect factory campaign work, and, if such
 14 13 parts are in excess of the dealer's requirements, the dealer
 14 14 may return unused, undamaged parts to the warrantor for credit
 14 15 after completion of the factory campaign.
 14 16    c.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers for authorized
 14 17 repairs effected by the dealer on merchandise damaged in
 14 18 manufacture or in transit to the dealer by a carrier designated
 14 19 by the warrantor, factory branch, distributor, or distributor
 14 20 branch.
 14 21    d.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers in accordance
 14 22 with the schedule of compensation provided to the dealer
 14 23 pursuant to this section if the warranty services for which
 14 24 compensation is claimed are performed in a timely and competent
 14 25 manner as required in this section.
 14 26    e.  Intentionally  misrepresent in any way to consumers that
 14 27 warranties with respect to the manufacture, performance, or
 14 28 design of recreational vehicles are made by the dealer as
 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.
 14 30    f.  Require the warrantor's dealers to make warranties to a
 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.

 14 34    a.  Fail to perform predelivery inspection functions in a
 14 35 competent and timely manner, as specified by the warrantor.
 15  1    b.  Fail to perform warranty services authorized by the
 15  2 warrantor in a competent and timely manner on any transient

 15  4 by that dealer.

 15  6 each repair, the total number of repair attempts conducted on

 14  8 to recreational vehicle owners and dealers, the expected date
 14  9 by which necessary parts and equipment, including tires and
 14 10 chassis or chassis parts, will be available to dealers to
 14 11 perform the factory campaign work.  The warrantor may ship
 14 12 parts to a dealer to effect factory campaign work, and, if such
 14 13 parts are in excess of the dealer's requirements, the dealer
 14 14 may return unused, undamaged parts to the warrantor for credit
 14 15 after completion of the factory campaign.
 14 16    c.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers for authorized
 14 17 repairs effected by the dealer on merchandise damaged in
 14 18 manufacture or in transit to the dealer by a carrier designated
 14 19 by the warrantor, factory branch, distributor, or distributor
 14 20 branch.
 14 21    d.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers in accordance
 14 22 with the schedule of compensation provided to the dealer
 14 23 pursuant to this section if the warranty services for which
 14 24 compensation is claimed are performed in a timely and competent
 14 25 manner as required in this section.
 14 26    e.  Intentionally  misrepresent in any way to consumers that
 14 27 warranties with respect to the manufacture, performance, or
 14 28 design of recreational vehicles are made by the dealer as
 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.
 14 30    f.  Require the warrantor's dealers to make warranties to a
 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.
 14 33    9.  A dealer shall not do any of the following:
 14 34    a.  Fail to perform predelivery inspection functions in a
 14 35 competent and timely manner, as specified by the warrantor.
 15  1    b.  Fail to perform warranty services authorized by the
 15  2 warrantor in a competent and timely manner on any transient
 15  3 consumer's recreational vehicle of a line=make sold or serviced
 15  4 by that dealer.
 15  5    c.  Fail to accurately document the time spent completing
 15  6 each repair, the total number of repair attempts conducted on
 15  7 a single unit, and the number of repair attempts for the same
 15  8 repair conducted on a single recreational vehicle.
 15  9    d.  Fail to notify the warrantor within ten days of a second
 15 10 repair attempt on a recreational vehicle which impairs the use,
 15 11 value, or safety of the vehicle.
 15 12    e.  Fail to maintain written records, including a consumer's
 15 13 signature, regarding the amount of time a unit is stored for
 15 14 the consumer's convenience during a repair.
 15 15    f.  Make fraudulent warranty claims or misrepresent the terms
 15 16 of any warranty.
 15 17    Sec. 7.   13 13 part, accessory, or complete component at actual wholesale cost
 13 14 plus a minimum of a thirty percent handling charge, up to a
 13 15 maximum of one hundred fifty dollars and the cost, if any, of
 13 16 freight to return such part, component, or accessory to the
 13 17 warrantor.
 13 18    4.  Warranty audits of dealer records may be conducted by a
 13 19 warrantor within twelve months from the payment of a warranty
 13 20 claim, and dealer claims for warranty compensation shall not
 13 21 be denied except for cause, such as performance of nonwarranty
 13 22 repairs, material noncompliance with the warrantor's published
 13 23 policies and procedures, lack of material documentation, fraud,
 13 24 or misrepresentation.
 13 25    5.  A dealer shall submit claims for compensation for the
 13 26 performance of warranty services to the warrantor within
 13 27 forty=five days after completion of the warranty services.
 13 28    6.  A dealer shall immediately notify a warrantor verbally
 13 29 or in writing if the dealer is unable to perform diagnostic
 13 30 services and warranty services within ten days of receipt of a
 13 31 verbal or written complaint from a consumer.
 13 32    7.  A warrantor shall disapprove a claim submitted by
 13 33 a dealer for compensation for the performance of warranty
 13 34 services, in writing, within forty=five days after submission
 13 35 of the claim in the manner and form prescribed by the
 14  1 warrantor.   A claim not specifically disapproved as required
 14  2 by this subsection shall be deemed approved and shall be paid
 14  3 within sixty days of submission of the claim.
 14  4    8.  A warrantor shall not do any of the following:
 14  5    a.  Fail to perform any of the warrantor's obligations with
 14  6 respect to its warranted products.
 14  7    b.  Fail to include, in written notices of a factory campaign
 14  8 to recreational vehicle owners and dealers, the expected date
 14  9 by which necessary parts and equipment, including tires and
 14 10 chassis or chassis parts, will be available to dealers to
 14 11 perform the factory campaign work.  The warrantor may ship
 14 12 parts to a dealer to effect factory campaign work, and, if such
 14 13 parts are in excess of the dealer's requirements, the dealer
 14 14 may return unused, undamaged parts to the warrantor for credit
 14 15 after completion of the factory campaign.
 14 16    c.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers for authorized
 14 17 repairs effected by the dealer on merchandise damaged in
 14 18 manufacture or in transit to the dealer by a carrier designated
 14 19 by the warrantor, factory branch, distributor, or distributor
 14 20 branch.
 14 21    d.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers in accordance
 14 22 with the schedule of compensation provided to the dealer
 14 23 pursuant to this section if the warranty services for which
 14 24 compensation is claimed are performed in a timely and competent
 14 25 manner as required in this section.

 14 27 warranties with respect to the manufacture, performance, or
 14 28 design of recreational vehicles are made by the dealer as
 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.

 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.

 15  9    d.  Fail to notify the warrantor within ten days of a second
 15 10 repair attempt on a recreational vehicle which impairs the use,
 15 11 value, or safety of the vehicle.
 15 12    e.  Fail to maintain written records, including a consumer's
 15 13 signature, regarding the amount of time a unit is stored for
 15 14 the consumer's convenience during a repair.
 15 15    f.  Make fraudulent warranty claims or misrepresent the terms
 15 16 of any warranty.
 15 17    Sec. 7.   13 20 claim, and dealer claims for warranty compensation shall not
 13 21 be denied except for cause, such as performance of nonwarranty
 13 22 repairs, material noncompliance with the warrantor's published
 13 23 policies and procedures, lack of material documentation, fraud,
 13 24 or misrepresentation.
 13 25    5.  A dealer shall submit claims for compensation for the
 13 26 performance of warranty services to the warrantor within
 13 27 forty=five days after completion of the warranty services.
 13 28    6.  A dealer shall immediately notify a warrantor verbally
 13 29 or in writing if the dealer is unable to perform diagnostic
 13 30 services and warranty services within ten days of receipt of a
 13 31 verbal or written complaint from a consumer.
 13 32    7.  A warrantor shall disapprove a claim submitted by
 13 33 a dealer for compensation for the performance of warranty
 13 34 services, in writing, within forty=five days after submission
 13 35 of the claim in the manner and form prescribed by the
 14  1 warrantor.   A claim not specifically disapproved as required
 14  2 by this subsection shall be deemed approved and shall be paid
 14  3 within sixty days of submission of the claim.
 14  4    8.  A warrantor shall not do any of the following:
 14  5    a.  Fail to perform any of the warrantor's obligations with
 14  6 respect to its warranted products.
 14  7    b.  Fail to include, in written notices of a factory campaign
 14  8 to recreational vehicle owners and dealers, the expected date
 14  9 by which necessary parts and equipment, including tires and
 14 10 chassis or chassis parts, will be available to dealers to
 14 11 perform the factory campaign work.  The warrantor may ship
 14 12 parts to a dealer to effect factory campaign work, and, if such
 14 13 parts are in excess of the dealer's requirements, the dealer
 14 14 may return unused, undamaged parts to the warrantor for credit
 14 15 after completion of the factory campaign.
 14 16    c.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers for authorized
 14 17 repairs effected by the dealer on merchandise damaged in
 14 18 manufacture or in transit to the dealer by a carrier designated
 14 19 by the warrantor, factory branch, distributor, or distributor
 14 20 branch.
 14 21    d.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers in accordance
 14 22 with the schedule of compensation provided to the dealer
 14 23 pursuant to this section if the warranty services for which
 14 24 compensation is claimed are performed in a timely and competent
 14 25 manner as required in this section.
 14 26    e.  Intentionally  misrepresent in any way to consumers that
 14 27 warranties with respect to the manufacture, performance, or
 14 28 design of recreational vehicles are made by the dealer as
 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.
 14 30    f.  Require the warrantor's dealers to make warranties to a
 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.
 14 33    9.  A dealer shall not do any of the following:
 14 34    a.  Fail to perform predelivery inspection functions in a
 14 35 competent and timely manner, as specified by the warrantor.
 15  1    b.  Fail to perform warranty services authorized by the
 15  2 warrantor in a competent and timely manner on any transient
 15  3 consumer's recreational vehicle of a line=make sold or serviced
 15  4 by that dealer.
 15  5    c.  Fail to accurately document the time spent completing
 15  6 each repair, the total number of repair attempts conducted on
 15  7 a single unit, and the number of repair attempts for the same
 15  8 repair conducted on a single recreational vehicle.
 15  9    d.  Fail to notify the warrantor within ten days of a second
 15 10 repair attempt on a recreational vehicle which impairs the use,
 15 11 value, or safety of the vehicle.
 15 12    e.  Fail to maintain written records, including a consumer's
 15 13 signature, regarding the amount of time a unit is stored for
 15 14 the consumer's convenience during a repair.
 15 15    f.  Make fraudulent warranty claims or misrepresent the terms
 15 16 of any warranty.
 15 17    Sec. 7.   13 21 be denied except for cause, such as performance of nonwarranty
 13 22 repairs, material noncompliance with the warrantor's published
 13 23 policies and procedures, lack of material documentation, fraud,
 13 24 or misrepresentation.

 14  8 to recreational vehicle owners and dealers, the expected date

 14 10 chassis or chassis parts, will be available to dealers to
 14 11 perform the factory campaign work.  The warrantor may ship
 14 12 parts to a dealer to effect factory campaign work, and, if such
 14 13 parts are in excess of the dealer's requirements, the dealer
 14 14 may return unused, undamaged parts to the warrantor for credit
 14 15 after completion of the factory campaign.
 14 16    c.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers for authorized
 14 17 repairs effected by the dealer on merchandise damaged in
 14 18 manufacture or in transit to the dealer by a carrier designated
 14 19 by the warrantor, factory branch, distributor, or distributor
 14 20 branch.
 14 21    d.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers in accordance
 14 22 with the schedule of compensation provided to the dealer
 14 23 pursuant to this section if the warranty services for which
 14 24 compensation is claimed are performed in a timely and competent
 14 25 manner as required in this section.
 14 26    e.  Intentionally  misrepresent in any way to consumers that
 14 27 warranties with respect to the manufacture, performance, or
 14 28 design of recreational vehicles are made by the dealer as
 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.
 14 30    f.  Require the warrantor's dealers to make warranties to a
 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.
 14 33    9.  A dealer shall not do any of the following:
 14 34    a.  Fail to perform predelivery inspection functions in a
 14 35 competent and timely manner, as specified by the warrantor.
 15  1    b.  Fail to perform warranty services authorized by the
 15  2 warrantor in a competent and timely manner on any transient
 15  3 consumer's recreational vehicle of a line=make sold or serviced
 15  4 by that dealer.
 15  5    c.  Fail to accurately document the time spent completing
 15  6 each repair, the total number of repair attempts conducted on
 15  7 a single unit, and the number of repair attempts for the same
 15  8 repair conducted on a single recreational vehicle.
 15  9    d.  Fail to notify the warrantor within ten days of a second
 15 10 repair attempt on a recreational vehicle which impairs the use,
 15 11 value, or safety of the vehicle.
 15 12    e.  Fail to maintain written records, including a consumer's
 15 13 signature, regarding the amount of time a unit is stored for
 15 14 the consumer's convenience during a repair.
 15 15    f.  Make fraudulent warranty claims or misrepresent the terms
 15 16 of any warranty.
 15 17    Sec. 7.   13 29 or in writing if the dealer is unable to perform diagnostic
 13 30 services and warranty services within ten days of receipt of a
 13 31 verbal or written complaint from a consumer.
 13 32    7.  A warrantor shall disapprove a claim submitted by
 13 33 a dealer for compensation for the performance of warranty
 13 34 services, in writing, within forty=five days after submission
 13 35 of the claim in the manner and form prescribed by the
 14  1 warrantor.   A claim not specifically disapproved as required
 14  2 by this subsection shall be deemed approved and shall be paid
 14  3 within sixty days of submission of the claim.
 14  4    8.  A warrantor shall not do any of the following:

 14  6 respect to its warranted products.

 14  4    8.  A warrantor shall not do any of the following:
 14  5    a.  Fail to perform any of the warrantor's obligations with
 14  6 respect to its warranted products.
 14  7    b.  Fail to include, in written notices of a factory campaign
 14  8 to recreational vehicle owners and dealers, the expected date
 14  9 by which necessary parts and equipment, including tires and
 14 10 chassis or chassis parts, will be available to dealers to
 14 11 perform the factory campaign work.  The warrantor may ship
 14 12 parts to a dealer to effect factory campaign work, and, if such
 14 13 parts are in excess of the dealer's requirements, the dealer
 14 14 may return unused, undamaged parts to the warrantor for credit
 14 15 after completion of the factory campaign.
 14 16    c.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers for authorized
 14 17 repairs effected by the dealer on merchandise damaged in
 14 18 manufacture or in transit to the dealer by a carrier designated
 14 19 by the warrantor, factory branch, distributor, or distributor
 14 20 branch.
 14 21    d.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers in accordance
 14 22 with the schedule of compensation provided to the dealer
 14 23 pursuant to this section if the warranty services for which
 14 24 compensation is claimed are performed in a timely and competent
 14 25 manner as required in this section.
 14 26    e.  Intentionally  misrepresent in any way to consumers that
 14 27 warranties with respect to the manufacture, performance, or
 14 28 design of recreational vehicles are made by the dealer as
 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.
 14 30    f.  Require the warrantor's dealers to make warranties to a
 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.
 14 33    9.  A dealer shall not do any of the following:
 14 34    a.  Fail to perform predelivery inspection functions in a
 14 35 competent and timely manner, as specified by the warrantor.
 15  1    b.  Fail to perform warranty services authorized by the
 15  2 warrantor in a competent and timely manner on any transient
 15  3 consumer's recreational vehicle of a line=make sold or serviced
 15  4 by that dealer.
 15  5    c.  Fail to accurately document the time spent completing
 15  6 each repair, the total number of repair attempts conducted on
 15  7 a single unit, and the number of repair attempts for the same
 15  8 repair conducted on a single recreational vehicle.
 15  9    d.  Fail to notify the warrantor within ten days of a second
 15 10 repair attempt on a recreational vehicle which impairs the use,
 15 11 value, or safety of the vehicle.
 15 12    e.  Fail to maintain written records, including a consumer's
 15 13 signature, regarding the amount of time a unit is stored for
 15 14 the consumer's convenience during a repair.
 15 15    f.  Make fraudulent warranty claims or misrepresent the terms
 15 16 of any warranty.

 14 29 warrantor or co=warrantor.
 14 30    f.  Require the warrantor's dealers to make warranties to a
 14 31 consumer that are in any manner related to the manufacture of
 14 32 the recreational vehicle.
 14 33    9.  A dealer shall not do any of the following:
 14 34    a.  Fail to perform predelivery inspection functions in a
 14 35 competent and timely manner, as specified by the warrantor.
 15  1    b.  Fail to perform warranty services authorized by the
 15  2 warrantor in a competent and timely manner on any transient
 15  3 consumer's recreational vehicle of a line=make sold or serviced
 15  4 by that dealer.
 15  5    c.  Fail to accurately document the time spent completing
 15  6 each repair, the total number of repair attempts conducted on
 15  7 a single unit, and the number of repair attempts for the same
 15  8 repair conducted on a single recreational vehicle.
 15  9    d.  Fail to notify the warrantor within ten days of a second
 15 10 repair attempt on a recreational vehicle which impairs the use,
 15 11 value, or safety of the vehicle.
 15 12    e.  Fail to maintain written records, including a consumer's
 15 13 signature, regarding the amount of time a unit is stored for
 15 14 the consumer's convenience during a repair.
 15 15    f.  Make fraudulent warranty claims or misrepresent the terms
 15 16 of any warranty.
 15 17    Sec. 7.   14 16    c.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers for authorized
 14 17 repairs effected by the dealer on merchandise damaged in
 14 18 manufacture or in transit to the dealer by a carrier designated
 14 19 by the warrantor, factory branch, distributor, or distributor
 14 20 branch.
 14 21    d.  Fail to compensate the warrantor's dealers in accordance
 14 22 with the schedule of compensation provided to the dealer
 14 23 pursuant to this section if the warranty services for which
 14 24 compensation is claimed are performed in a timely and competent
 14 25 manner as required in this section.

 15  9    d.  Fail to notify the warrantor within ten days of a second
 15 10 repair attempt on a recreational vehicle which impairs the use,
 15 11 value, or safety of the vehicle.
 15 12    e.  Fail to maintain written records, including a consumer's
 15 13 signature, regarding the amount of time a unit is stored for
 15 14 the consumer's convenience during a repair.
 15 15    f.  Make fraudulent warranty claims or misrepresent the terms
 15 16 of any warranty.

 15 17    Sec. 7.   15 16 of any warranty.
 15 17    Sec. 7.   15 17    Sec. 7.   15 18    1.  a.  Notwithstanding the terms of a manufacturer and
 15 19 dealer agreement, a warrantor shall indemnify and hold harmless
 15 20 the warrantor's dealer against any losses or damages to the
 15 21 extent that the losses or damages are caused by the negligence
 15 22 or willful misconduct of the warrantor.
 15 23    b.  A dealer shall not be denied indemnification for failure
 15 24 to discover, disclose, or remedy a defect in the design or
 15 25 manufacturing of a new recreational vehicle.  A dealer may
 15 26 be denied indemnification if the dealer fails to remedy a
 15 27 known and announced defect in accordance with the written
 15 28 instructions of the warrantor for whom the dealer is obligated
 15 29 to perform warranty services.
 15 30    c.  A dealer shall provide to the warrantor a copy of any
 15 31 pending lawsuit in which allegations are made that are covered
 15 32 by the provisions of this subsection within ten days after
 15 33 receiving notice of such lawsuit.
 15 34    d.  Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary, this
 15 35 subsection continues to apply even after a new recreational
 16  1 vehicle is titled.
 16  2    2.  a.  Notwithstanding the terms of a manufacturer and
 16  3 dealer agreement, a dealer shall indemnify and hold harmless
 16  4 the dealer's warrantor against any losses or damages to the
 16  5 extent that the losses or damages are caused by the negligence
 16  6 or willful misconduct of the dealer.
 16  7    b.  A warrantor shall provide to the dealer a copy of any
 16  8 pending lawsuit in which allegations are made that are covered
 16  9 by the provisions of this subsection within ten days after
 16 10 receiving notice of such lawsuit.
 16 11    c.  Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary, this
 16 12 subsection continues to apply even after a new recreational
 16 13 vehicle is titled.

 16  3 dealer agreement, a dealer shall indemnify and hold harmless
 16  4 the dealer's warrantor against any losses or damages to the
 16  5 extent that the losses or damages are caused by the negligence
 16  6 or willful misconduct of the dealer.
 16  7    b.  A warrantor shall provide to the dealer a copy of any
 16  8 pending lawsuit in which allegations are made that are covered
 16  9 by the provisions of this subsection within ten days after
 16 10 receiving notice of such lawsuit.
 16 11    c.  Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary, this
 16 12 subsection continues to apply even after a new recreational
 16 13 vehicle is titled.
 16 14    Sec. 8.   15 35 subsection continues to apply even after a new recreational
 16  1 vehicle is titled.

 16 12 subsection continues to apply even after a new recreational
 16 13 vehicle is titled.

 16 14    Sec. 8.   16 11    c.  Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary, this
 16 12 subsection continues to apply even after a new recreational
 16 13 vehicle is titled.
 16 14    Sec. 8.   16 12 subsection continues to apply even after a new recreational
 16 13 vehicle is titled.
 16 14    Sec. 8.   16 13 vehicle is titled.
 16 14    Sec. 8.   16 14    Sec. 8.   16 15 dealer.
 16 16    1.  Whenever a new recreational vehicle is damaged prior
 16 17 to transit or is damaged in transit to the dealer and the
 16 18 carrier or means of transportation has been selected by the
 16 19 manufacturer or distributor, the dealer shall notify the
 16 20 manufacturer or distributor of the damage within the time frame
 16 21 specified in the manufacturer and dealer agreement and shall do
 16 22 either of the following:
 16 23    a.  Request from the manufacturer or distributor
 16 24 authorization to replace the components, parts, or accessories
 16 25 damaged or otherwise repair the vehicle to make the vehicle
 16 26 ready for sale.
 16 27    b.  Reject the vehicle within the time frame set forth in
 16 28 subsection 4.
 16 29    2.  If the manufacturer or distributor refuses to authorize
 16 30 repair of the new recreational vehicle within ten days after
 16 31 receipt of notification, or if the dealer rejects the new
 16 32 recreational vehicle because of damage, ownership of the
 16 33 vehicle shall revert to the manufacturer or distributor.
 16 34    3.  The dealer shall exercise due care when in custody of
 16 35 a damaged new recreational vehicle, but the dealer shall have
 17  1 no other obligations, financial or otherwise, with respect to
 17  2 that vehicle following rejection of the vehicle as provided in
 17  3 subsection 4.
 17  4    4.  The time frame for inspection and rejection of a damaged
 17  5 new recreational vehicle by a dealer shall be included in the
 17  6 manufacturer and dealer agreement and shall not be less than
 17  7 two business days after the physical delivery of the vehicle
 17  8 to the dealer.
 17  9    5.  Any new recreational vehicle that has, at the time of
 17 10 delivery to the dealer, an unreasonable amount of miles on the
 17 11 vehicle's odometer, as determined by the dealer, may be subject
 17 12 to rejection by the dealer and ownership of the vehicle shall
 17 13 revert to the manufacturer or distributor.  In no instance
 17 14 shall a dealer deem an amount less than the distance between
 17 15 the dealer and the manufacturer's factory or between the dealer
 17 16 and the distributor's point of distribution, plus one hundred
 17 17 miles, as an unreasonable amount of miles.
 17 18    Sec. 9.   16 16    1.  Whenever a new recreational vehicle is damaged prior
 16 17 to transit or is damaged in transit to the dealer and the
 16 18 carrier or means of transportation has been selected by the
 16 19 manufacturer or distributor, the dealer shall notify the
 16 20 manufacturer or distributor of the damage within the time frame
 16 21 specified in the manufacturer and dealer agreement and shall do
 16 22 either of the following:
 16 23    a.  Request from the manufacturer or distributor
 16 24 authorization to replace the components, parts, or accessories
 16 25 damaged or otherwise repair the vehicle to make the vehicle
 16 26 ready for sale.
 16 27    b.  Reject the vehicle within the time frame set forth in
 16 28 subsection 4.
 16 29    2.  If the manufacturer or distributor refuses to authorize
 16 30 repair of the new recreational vehicle within ten days after
 16 31 receipt of notification, or if the dealer rejects the new
 16 32 recreational vehicle because of damage, ownership of the
 16 33 vehicle shall revert to the manufacturer or distributor.

 16 35 a damaged new recreational vehicle, but the dealer shall have
 17  1 no other obligations, financial or otherwise, with respect to
 17  2 that vehicle following rejection of the vehicle as provided in
 17  3 subsection 4.

 17 12 to rejection by the dealer and ownership of the vehicle shall
 17 13 revert to the manufacturer or distributor.  In no instance
 17 14 shall a dealer deem an amount less than the distance between
 17 15 the dealer and the manufacturer's factory or between the dealer
 17 16 and the distributor's point of distribution, plus one hundred
 17 17 miles, as an unreasonable amount of miles.
 17 18    Sec. 9.   16 29    2.  If the manufacturer or distributor refuses to authorize
 16 30 repair of the new recreational vehicle within ten days after
 16 31 receipt of notification, or if the dealer rejects the new
 16 32 recreational vehicle because of damage, ownership of the
 16 33 vehicle shall revert to the manufacturer or distributor.
 16 34    3.  The dealer shall exercise due care when in custody of
 16 35 a damaged new recreational vehicle, but the dealer shall have
 17  1 no other obligations, financial or otherwise, with respect to
 17  2 that vehicle following rejection of the vehicle as provided in
 17  3 subsection 4.
 17  4    4.  The time frame for inspection and rejection of a damaged
 17  5 new recreational vehicle by a dealer shall be included in the
 17  6 manufacturer and dealer agreement and shall not be less than
 17  7 two business days after the physical delivery of the vehicle
 17  8 to the dealer.
 17  9    5.  Any new recreational vehicle that has, at the time of
 17 10 delivery to the dealer, an unreasonable amount of miles on the
 17 11 vehicle's odometer, as determined by the dealer, may be subject
 17 12 to rejection by the dealer and ownership of the vehicle shall
 17 13 revert to the manufacturer or distributor.  In no instance
 17 14 shall a dealer deem an amount less than the distance between
 17 15 the dealer and the manufacturer's factory or between the dealer
 17 16 and the distributor's point of distribution, plus one hundred
 17 17 miles, as an unreasonable amount of miles.
 17 18    Sec. 9.   16 30 repair of the new recreational vehicle within ten days after
 16 31 receipt of notification, or if the dealer rejects the new
 16 32 recreational vehicle because of damage, ownership of the
 16 33 vehicle shall revert to the manufacturer or distributor.

 16 35 a damaged new recreational vehicle, but the dealer shall have
 17  1 no other obligations, financial or otherwise, with respect to
 17  2 that vehicle following rejection of the vehicle as provided in
 17  3 subsection 4.

 17 18    Sec. 9.   17 18    Sec. 9.   17 19    1.  A manufacturer or distributor shall not coerce or attempt
 17 20 to coerce a dealer to do any of the following:
 17 21    a.  Purchase a product that the dealer did not order.
 17 22    b.  Enter into an agreement with the manufacturer or
 17 23 distributor.
 17 24    c.  Enter into an agreement that requires the dealer to
 17 25 submit its disputes to binding arbitration or otherwise waive
 17 26 rights or responsibilities provided for under this chapter.
 17 27    2.  As used in this section, "coerce" includes but is not
 17 28 limited to doing any of the following:
 17 29    a.  Threatening to terminate, cancel, or not renew a
 17 30 manufacturer and dealer agreement without good cause.
 17 31    b.  Threatening to withhold product lines the dealer is
 17 32 entitled to purchase pursuant to the manufacturer and dealer
 17 33 agreement.
 17 34    c.  Threatening to delay product delivery as an inducement to
 17 35 amending the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 18  1    Sec. 10.   17 20 to coerce a dealer to do any of the following:
 17 21    a.  Purchase a product that the dealer did not order.
 17 22    b.  Enter into an agreement with the manufacturer or
 17 23 distributor.
 17 24    c.  Enter into an agreement that requires the dealer to
 17 25 submit its disputes to binding arbitration or otherwise waive
 17 26 rights or responsibilities provided for under this chapter.

 17 28 limited to doing any of the following:

 17 32 entitled to purchase pursuant to the manufacturer and dealer
 17 33 agreement.

 17 35 amending the manufacturer and dealer agreement.

 18  1    Sec. 10.   17 35 amending the manufacturer and dealer agreement.
 18  1    Sec. 10.   18  1    Sec. 10.   18  2    1.  A dealer, manufacturer, distributor, or warrantor
 18  3 injured by another party's violation of this chapter may bring
 18  4 a civil action in district court to recover actual damages
 18  5 resulting from such violation. Venue for a civil action
 18  6 authorized by this section shall be exclusively in the county
 18  7 in which the dealer's business is located.  In an action
 18  8 involving more than one dealer, venue may be in any county in
 18  9 which any dealer that is a party to the action is located.
 18 10    2.  Prior to bringing suit under this section, the party
 18 11 alleging a violation of this chapter may serve a written
 18 12 request for mediation upon the alleged offending party.
 18 13    a.  The request for mediation shall be served upon the
 18 14 alleged offending party via certified mail at the address
 18 15 stated in the manufacturer and dealer agreement between the
 18 16 parties.
 18 17    b.  The request for mediation shall contain a brief statement
 18 18 of the dispute or violation alleged and relief sought by the
 18 19 party filing the request.
 18 20    c.  Within twenty days after service of a request for
 18 21 mediation, the party that was served with the request shall
 18 22 send via certified mail a written response indicating whether
 18 23 the party is willing to mediate the dispute.  If both parties
 18 24 agree to mediation, the parties shall mutually select an
 18 25 independent certified mediator and shall meet with that
 18 26 mediator for the purpose of attempting to resolve the dispute
 18 27 or alleged violation.  The meeting place for the mediation
 18 28 shall be in this state at a location selected by the mediator.
 18 29 The mediator may extend the date for the meeting for good cause
 18 30 shown by either party or upon stipulation of both parties.
 18 31    d.  If the dispute will be mediated, the service of a request
 18 32 for mediation under this section shall toll the time for the
 18 33 filing of any complaint, petition, protest, or other action
 18 34 under this chapter until representatives of both parties have
 18 35 met with the mutually selected mediator for the purpose of
 19  1 attempting to resolve the dispute or alleged violation.  If a
 19  2 complaint, petition, protest, or other action has been filed
 19  3 before that meeting, the court shall enter an order suspending
 19  4 any proceeding or action on such complaint, petition, protest,
 19  5 or other action until the mediation meeting has occurred and
 19  6 may, upon written stipulation of all parties to the proceeding
 19  7 or action that they wish to continue mediation under this
 19  8 section, enter an order suspending the proceeding or action for
 19  9 as long a period of time as the court considers appropriate.
 19 10    e.  Each party to the mediation shall bear their own costs
 19 11 for attorney fees and shall divide equally among them the cost
 19 12 of the mediator.
 19 13    3.  In addition to the remedies provided in this section,
 19 14 and notwithstanding the existence of any additional remedy at
 19 15 law, a manufacturer, distributor, warrantor, or dealer may
 19 16 apply to the district court for the grant, upon a hearing and
 19 17 for cause shown, of a temporary or permanent injunction, or
 19 18 both, restraining any person from acting as a dealer without
 19 19 being properly licensed, from violating or continuing to
 19 20 violate any of the provisions of this chapter, or from failing
 19 21 or refusing to comply with the requirements of this chapter.
 19 22 Such injunction shall be issued without bond.  A single act in
 19 23 violation of the provisions of this chapter shall be sufficient
 19 24 cause to authorize the issuance of an injunction pursuant to
 19 25 this subsection.
 19 26    Sec. 11.   18  3 injured by another party's violation of this chapter may bring
 18  4 a civil action in district court to recover actual damages
 18  5 resulting from such violation. Venue for a civil action
 18  6 authorized by this section shall be exclusively in the county
 18  7 in which the dealer's business is located.  In an action
 18  8 involving more than one dealer, venue may be in any county in
 18  9 which any dealer that is a party to the action is located.
 18 10    2.  Prior to bringing suit under this section, the party
 18 11 alleging a violation of this chapter may serve a written
 18 12 request for mediation upon the alleged offending party.
 18 13    a.  The request for mediation shall be served upon the
 18 14 alleged offending party via certified mail at the address
 18 15 stated in the manufacturer and dealer agreement between the
 18 16 parties.
 18 17    b.  The request for mediation shall contain a brief statement
 18 18 of the dispute or violation alleged and relief sought by the
 18 19 party filing the request.
 18 20    c.  Within twenty days after service of a request for
 18 21 mediation, the party that was served with the request shall
 18 22 send via certified mail a written response indicating whether
 18 23 the party is willing to mediate the dispute.  If both parties
 18 24 agree to mediation, the parties shall mutually select an
 18 25 independent certified mediator and shall meet with that
 18 26 mediator for the purpose of attempting to resolve the dispute
 18 27 or alleged violation.  The meeting place for the mediation
 18 28 shall be in this state at a location selected by the mediator.
 18 29 The mediator may extend the date for the meeting for good cause
 18 30 shown by either party or upon stipulation of both parties.
 18 31    d.  If the dispute will be mediated, the service of a request
 18 32 for mediation under this section shall toll the time for the
 18 33 filing of any complaint, petition, protest, or other action
 18 34 under this chapter until representatives of both parties have
 18 35 met with the mutually selected mediator for the purpose of
 19  1 attempting to resolve the dispute or alleged violation.  If a
 19  2 complaint, petition, protest, or other action has been filed
 19  3 before that meeting, the court shall enter an order suspending
 19  4 any proceeding or action on such complaint, petition, protest,
 19  5 or other action until the mediation meeting has occurred and
 19  6 may, upon written stipulation of all parties to the proceeding
 19  7 or action that they wish to continue mediation under this
 19  8 section, enter an order suspending the proceeding or action for
 19  9 as long a period of time as the court considers appropriate.
 19 10    e.  Each party to the mediation shall bear their own costs
 19 11 for attorney fees and shall divide equally among them the cost
 19 12 of the mediator.
 19 13    3.  In addition to the remedies provided in this section,
 19 14 and notwithstanding the existence of any additional remedy at
 19 15 law, a manufacturer, distributor, warrantor, or dealer may
 19 16 apply to the district court for the grant, upon a hearing and
 19 17 for cause shown, of a temporary or permanent injunction, or
 19 18 both, restraining any person from acting as a dealer without
 19 19 being properly licensed, from violating or continuing to
 19 20 violate any of the provisions of this chapter, or from failing
 19 21 or refusing to comply with the requirements of this chapter.
 19 22 Such injunction shall be issued without bond.  A single act in
 19 23 violation of the provisions of this chapter shall be sufficient
 19 24 cause to authorize the issuance of an injunction pursuant to
 19 25 this subsection.
 19 26    Sec. 11.   18  4 a civil action in district court to recover actual damages
 18  5 resulting from such violation. Venue for a civil action
 18  6 authorized by this section shall be exclusively in the county
 18  7 in which the dealer's business is located.  In an action
 18  8 involving more than one dealer, venue may be in any county in
 18  9 which any dealer that is a party to the action is located.

 18 11 alleging a violation of this chapter may serve a written
 18 12 request for mediation upon the alleged offending party.
 18 13    a.  The request for mediation shall be served upon the
 18 14 alleged offending party via certified mail at the address
 18 15 stated in the manufacturer and dealer agreement between the
 18 16 parties.
 18 17    b.  The request for mediation shall contain a brief statement
 18 18 of the dispute or violation alleged and relief sought by the
 18 19 party filing the request.
 18 20    c.  Within twenty days after service of a request for
 18 21 mediation, the party that was served with the request shall
 18 22 send via certified mail a written response indicating whether
 18 23 the party is willing to mediate the dispute.  If both parties
 18 24 agree to mediation, the parties shall mutually select an
 18 25 independent certified mediator and shall meet with that
 18 26 mediator for the purpose of attempting to resolve the dispute
 18 27 or alleged violation.  The meeting place for the mediation
 18 28 shall be in this state at a location selected by the mediator.
 18 29 The mediator may extend the date for the meeting for good cause
 18 30 shown by either party or upon stipulation of both parties.
 18 31    d.  If the dispute will be mediated, the service of a request
 18 32 for mediation under this section shall toll the time for the
 18 33 filing of any complaint, petition, protest, or other action
 18 34 under this chapter until representatives of both parties have
 18 35 met with the mutually selected mediator for the purpose of
 19  1 attempting to resolve the dispute or alleged violation.  If a
 19  2 complaint, petition, protest, or other action has been filed
 19  3 before that meeting, the court shall enter an order suspending
 19  4 any proceeding or action on such complaint, petition, protest,
 19  5 or other action until the mediation meeting has occurred and
 19  6 may, upon written stipulation of all parties to the proceeding
 19  7 or action that they wish to continue mediation under this
 19  8 section, enter an order suspending the proceeding or action for
 19  9 as long a period of time as the court considers appropriate.
 19 10    e.  Each party to the mediation shall bear their own costs
 19 11 for attorney fees and shall divide equally among them the cost
 19 12 of the mediator.
 19 13    3.  In addition to the remedies provided in this section,
 19 14 and notwithstanding the existence of any additional remedy at
 19 15 law, a manufacturer, distributor, warrantor, or dealer may
 19 16 apply to the district court for the grant, upon a hearing and
 19 17 for cause shown, of a temporary or permanent injunction, or
 19 18 both, restraining any person from acting as a dealer without
 19 19 being properly licensed, from violating or continuing to
 19 20 violate any of the provisions of this chapter, or from failing

 19 23 violation of the provisions of this chapter shall be sufficient
 19 24 cause to authorize the issuance of an injunction pursuant to
 19 25 this subsection.

 18  7 in which the dealer's business is located.  In an action
 18  8 involving more than one dealer, venue may be in any county in
 18  9 which any dealer that is a party to the action is located.

 18 21 mediation, the party that was served with the request shall
 18 22 send via certified mail a written response indicating whether
 18 23 the party is willing to mediate the dispute.  If both parties
 18 24 agree to mediation, the parties shall mutually select an
 18 25 independent certified mediator and shall meet with that
 18 26 mediator for the purpose of attempting to resolve the dispute
 18 27 or alleged violation.  The meeting place for the mediation
 18 28 shall be in this state at a location selected by the mediator.
 18 29 The mediator may extend the date for the meeting for good cause
 18 30 shown by either party or upon stipulation of both parties.
 18 31    d.  If the dispute will be mediated, the service of a request
 18 32 for mediation under this section shall toll the time for the
 18 33 filing of any complaint, petition, protest, or other action
 18 34 under this chapter until representatives of both parties have
 18 35 met with the mutually selected mediator for the purpose of
 19  1 attempting to resolve the dispute or alleged violation.  If a
 19  2 complaint, petition, protest, or other action has been filed
 19  3 before that meeting, the court shall enter an order suspending
 19  4 any proceeding or action on such complaint, petition, protest,
 19  5 or other action until the mediation meeting has occurred and
 19  6 may, upon written stipulation of all parties to the proceeding
 19  7 or action that they wish to continue mediation under this
 19  8 section, enter an order suspending the proceeding or action for
 19  9 as long a period of time as the court considers appropriate.
 19 10    e.  Each party to the mediation shall bear their own costs
 19 11 for attorney fees and shall divide equally among them the cost
 19 12 of the mediator.
 19 13    3.  In addition to the remedies provided in this section,
 19 14 and notwithstanding the existence of any additional remedy at
 19 15 law, a manufacturer, distributor, warrantor, or dealer may
 19 16 apply to the district court for the grant, upon a hearing and
 19 17 for cause shown, of a temporary or permanent injunction, or
 19 18 both, restraining any person from acting as a dealer without
 19 19 being properly licensed, from violating or continuing to
 19 20 violate any of the provisions of this chapter, or from failing
 19 21 or refusing to comply with the requirements of this chapter.
 19 22 Such injunction shall be issued without bond.  A single act in
 19 23 violation of the provisions of this chapter shall be sufficient
 19 24 cause to authorize the issuance of an injunction pursuant to
 19 25 this subsection.
 19 26    Sec. 11.   18 14 alleged offending party via certified mail at the address
 18 15 stated in the manufacturer and dealer agreement between the
 18 16 parties.
 18 17    b.  The request for mediation shall contain a brief statement
 18 18 of the dispute or violation alleged and relief sought by the
 18 19 party filing the request.
 18 20    c.  Within twenty days after service of a request for
 18 21 mediation, the party that was served with the request shall
 18 22 send via certified mail a written response indicating whether
 18 23 the party is willing to mediate the dispute.  If both parties
 18 24 agree to mediation, the parties shall mutually select an
 18 25 independent certified mediator and shall meet with that
 18 26 mediator for the purpose of attempting to resolve the dispute
 18 27 or alleged violation.  The meeting place for the mediation
 18 28 shall be in this state at a location selected by the mediator.
 18 29 The mediator may extend the date for the meeting for good cause
 18 30 shown by either party or upon stipulation of both parties.
 18 31    d.  If the dispute will be mediated, the service of a request
 18 32 for mediation under this section shall toll the time for the
 18 33 filing of any complaint, petition, protest, or other action
 18 34 under this chapter until representatives of both parties have
 18 35 met with the mutually selected mediator for the purpose of
 19  1 attempting to resolve the dispute or alleged violation.  If a
 19  2 complaint, petition, protest, or other action has been filed
 19  3 before that meeting, the court shall enter an order suspending
 19  4 any proceeding or action on such complaint, petition, protest,
 19  5 or other action until the mediation meeting has occurred and
 19  6 may, upon written stipulation of all parties to the proceeding
 19  7 or action that they wish to continue mediation under this
 19  8 section, enter an order suspending the proceeding or action for
 19  9 as long a period of time as the court considers appropriate.
 19 10    e.  Each party to the mediation shall bear their own costs
 19 11 for attorney fees and shall divide equally among them the cost
 19 12 of the mediator.

 19 21 or refusing to comply with the requirements of this chapter.
 19 22 Such injunction shall be issued without bond.  A single act in
 19 23 violation of the provisions of this chapter shall be sufficient
 19 24 cause to authorize the issuance of an injunction pursuant to
 19 25 this subsection.
 19 26    Sec. 11.   18 26 mediator for the purpose of attempting to resolve the dispute
 18 27 or alleged violation.  The meeting place for the mediation
 18 28 shall be in this state at a location selected by the mediator.
 18 29 The mediator may extend the date for the meeting for good cause
 18 30 shown by either party or upon stipulation of both parties.
 18 31    d.  If the dispute will be mediated, the service of a request
 18 32 for mediation under this section shall toll the time for the
 18 33 filing of any complaint, petition, protest, or other action
 18 34 under this chapter until representatives of both parties have
 18 35 met with the mutually selected mediator for the purpose of
 19  1 attempting to resolve the dispute or alleged violation.  If a
 19  2 complaint, petition, protest, or other action has been filed
 19  3 before that meeting, the court shall enter an order suspending
 19  4 any proceeding or action on such complaint, petition, protest,
 19  5 or other action until the mediation meeting has occurred and
 19  6 may, upon written stipulation of all parties to the proceeding
 19  7 or action that they wish to continue mediation under this
 19  8 section, enter an order suspending the proceeding or action for
 19  9 as long a period of time as the court considers appropriate.
 19 10    e.  Each party to the mediation shall bear their own costs
 19 11 for attorney fees and shall divide equally among them the cost
 19 12 of the mediator.
 19 13    3.  In addition to the remedies provided in this section,
 19 14 and notwithstanding the existence of any additional remedy at
 19 15 law, a manufacturer, distributor, warrantor, or dealer may
 19 16 apply to the district court for the grant, upon a hearing and
 19 17 for cause shown, of a temporary or permanent injunction, or
 19 18 both, restraining any person from acting as a dealer without
 19 19 being properly licensed, from violating or continuing to
 19 20 violate any of the provisions of this chapter, or from failing
 19 21 or refusing to comply with the requirements of this chapter.
 19 22 Such injunction shall be issued without bond.  A single act in
 19 23 violation of the provisions of this chapter shall be sufficient
 19 24 cause to authorize the issuance of an injunction pursuant to
 19 25 this subsection.

 19 13    3.  In addition to the remedies provided in this section,
 19 14 and notwithstanding the existence of any additional remedy at
 19 15 law, a manufacturer, distributor, warrantor, or dealer may
 19 16 apply to the district court for the grant, upon a hearing and
 19 17 for cause shown, of a temporary or permanent injunction, or
 19 18 both, restraining any person from acting as a dealer without
 19 19 being properly licensed, from violating or continuing to
 19 20 violate any of the provisions of this chapter, or from failing
 19 21 or refusing to comply with the requirements of this chapter.
 19 22 Such injunction shall be issued without bond.  A single act in
 19 23 violation of the provisions of this chapter shall be sufficient
 19 24 cause to authorize the issuance of an injunction pursuant to
 19 25 this subsection.

 19 28 and dealer agreement restricting jurisdiction to a forum
 19 29 outside this state is void.

 19 31 and dealer agreement providing that the dealer consents to the
 19 32 jurisdiction of a forum outside this state is void.

 19 34 manufacturer and dealer agreement may be commenced wherever
 19 35 jurisdiction over the parties or subject matter exists, even
 20  1 if the manufacturer and dealer agreement limits actions or
 20  2 proceedings to a designated jurisdiction.

 20 32 Code 2015, are amended to read as follows:
 20 33    b.  "Travel trailer" means a vehicle without motive power
 20 34 used, manufactured, or constructed to permit its use as a
 20 35 conveyance upon the public streets and highways and designed
 21  1 to permit its use as a place of human habitation by one or more
 21  2 persons. The vehicle may be up to eight feet six inches in
 21  3 width and its overall length shall not exceed  20 28 transportation.

 22 13    Sec. 21.  Section 322C.3, subsection 1, Code 2015, is amended
 22 14 to read as follows:
 22 15    1.  A person shall not engage in this state in the business
 22 16 of selling at retail new travel trailers of any make, or
 22 17 represent or advertise that the person is engaged or intends
 22 18 to engage in such business in this state, unless the person is
 22 19 authorized by a contract in writing between that person and the
 22 20 manufacturer or distributor of that make of new travel trailers
 22 21 to sell the trailers in this state  22  8    Sec. 20.  Section 322C.2, subsection 10, Code 2015, is
 22  9 amended by striking the subsection and inserting in lieu
 22 10 thereof the following:
 22 11    10.  "Travel trailer" means the same as defined in section
 22 12 322E.1.
 22 13    Sec. 21.  Section 322C.3, subsection 1, Code 2015, is amended
 22 14 to read as follows:
 22 15    1.  A person shall not engage in this state in the business
 22 16 of selling at retail new travel trailers of any make, or

 22 10 thereof the following:
 22 11    10.  "Travel trailer" means the same as defined in section
 22 12 322E.1.
 22 13    Sec. 21.  Section 322C.3, subsection 1, Code 2015, is amended
 22 14 to read as follows:

 22 16 of selling at retail new travel trailers of any make, or

 22 24    Sec. 22.  Section 322C.3, subsections 5 and 7, Code 2015, are
 22 25 amended by striking the subsections.
 22 26    Sec. 23.  Section 537A.10, subsection 1, paragraph c,
 22 27 subparagraph (3), Code 2015, is amended to read as follows:
 22 28    (3)  "Franchise" also does not include any contract under
 22 29 which a petroleum retailer or petroleum distributor is
 22 30 authorized or permitted to occupy leased marketing premises,
 22 31 which premises are to be employed in connection with the sale,
 22 32 consignment, or distribution of motor fuel under a trademark
 22 33 which is owned or controlled by a refiner which is regulated
 22 34 by the federal Petroleum Marketing Practices Act, 15 U.S.C.
 22 35 {2801 et seq. The term "refiner" means any person engaged in
 23  1 the refining of crude oil to produce motor fuel, and includes

 23  3 include a contract entered into by any person regulated under
 23  4 chapter 103A, division IV, or chapter 123, 322, 322A, 322C,
